title: Temporary Personal Assistant
description:
***No phone calls please.***

***Position: Temporary Personal Assistant***

In this role as "temporary" Personal Assistant to a high profile Manhattan business executive, you will perform a variety of tasks that require discretion and independent judgment in order to fully support this client's senior level executive. Your responsibilities will include considering, comparing, and evaluating different courses of action and then making a decision or recommending a decision on sufficiently important and consequential matters that go directly to the heart of business operations. This would include analyzing and maintaining confidential information such as performance evaluations, personnel documents, contracts, proprietary information and trade secrets. You will have access to email and social media accounts where you will be responding on behalf of Senior Executive. ***Note: Must have 24/7 mindset.***

You will also be required to communicate on behalf of Senior Executive and his liaison to organize and administer all aspects of the business when they are out of the office traveling. You will also be responsible for arranging travel and assisting with the production and execution of live events and training. This position requires someone with a strong business acumen or legal background. The successful candidate would be reviewing legal documents and respond to sensitive communications without much input. You should be highly experienced, fast paced and professional at all times, (appearance, written / verbal communication). **Hourly rate: $56.00 per hour, plus over time. This position could turn in to a permanent position.**

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Experience with social media platforms (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, etc.)
* Ability to delegate, prepare and compose content while working under pressure.
* Provides wide range of complex office support.
* Serves as principal contact and liaison with all employees/guest and external contacts.
* Manages complex calendars, arranges for meetings, appointments and travelarrangements.
* Coordinate communication and handle wide-range information dissemination.
* Maintain and support personnel records.
* Interprets and announces updates and event information to office team(s) as needed.
* Pro at maintaining calendar, conference calls, travel and all business functions.
* Ability to effectively anticipate needs.
* Maintain contact databases, social media and mailing lists with current updates.
* Contributes to unit effort by accomplishing related duties as required.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Must reside in within 45 minutes of Manhattan (Zip: 10024)
* 5 plus years’ experience as an Executive Assistant/Personal Assistant to the high profile, celebrity, ultra high networth, etc.
* Tech savvy with Apple/Mac computers and products
* Strong professional, verbal and written communication skills
* Superb service-oriented mindset
* Outstanding organizational and time management skills
* High level of attention to detail while performing a variety of different tasks as needed
* Demonstrated ability to work productively with counterparts in a cross-functionalcapacity
* Must be able to respond quickly in an environment of changing priorities
* Ability to effectively prioritize and manage your time to address multiple responsibilitiesin a fast-paced, professional environment.
* Positive, team-oriented attitude
* Experience with public relations, marketing or social media a plus

***SKILLS:***

* Written and verbal communication skills
* Reporting skills
* Supply management
* Scheduling
* Computer software skills including Microsoft Office
* Organization skills
* Time management skills
* Presentation skills
* Travel logistics
* Promoting process improvement
* Exercising independent judgement

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $56.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you CURRENTLY reside within 45 minutes of Manhattan?
* Do you have experience working for the high networth, ultra hig networth or a-list celebrities ? (Example: Spielberg, Zuckerberg, Musk types)
* Can you start immediately?
* Do you understand that this is a TEMPORARY position paying $56.00 per hour...there might be a possibility of the position turning in to a permanent position if all goes well.

Work Location: In person

title: Certified Recovery Peer Advocate Transitional Housing (Queens)
description:
Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we’ve been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

The OASAS **Certified Recovery Peer Advocate** requires someone who is culturally aware and sensitive to the needs of the targeted population, possess excellent computer skills, be able to function as a part of a multidisciplinary team and understand therapy and group work rooted in evidenced based approaches for intervention and management strategies. Certified Recovery Peer Advocate services are peer-delivered services with a rehabilitation and recovery focus. They are designed to promote skills for coping with and managing behavioral health symptoms while facilitating the utilization of natural resources and the enhancement of recovery-oriented principles (e.g., hope and self-efficacy, and community living skills). Certified Recovery Peer Advocate support uses trauma-informed, non-clinical assistance to achieve long-term recovery from a behavioral health disorder.

Under supervision of the Program Director or designee, the requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. The provider ensures strengths based, person centered quality of care provided in a culturally and linguistically meaningful therapeutic environment. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities as defined by the ADA to perform the essential functions of the job. The functions below outline the general responsibilities associated with this position. Each of these functions is considered critical to effective department operations and our Mission. It is expected that all staff in this position will have satisfactory attendance and will perform these functions as assigned in a competent, cooperative, and timely manner. The Job Description will be reviewed periodically for accuracy and/or adjusted according to business necessity.

**Pays: $45,000 per year.**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Help promote skills for coping and managing behavioral health symptoms.
* Educates clients about Medication Assisted Treatments (MAT), prevention, harm reduction, and Narcan.
* Work as a member of multidisciplinary treatment team that practices client centered and holistic care.
* Accompany clients to appointments and complete warm handoff referrals to SUD.
* Communicate effectively with clients and collateral contacts.
* Conduct outreach for care coordination.
* Assist in the selection and utilization of self-directed recovery tools such as relapse prevention planning.
* Connect individuals to self-help groups in the community.
* Provide recovery education and counseling to individuals.
* Provide preventative and crisis support services.
* Conduct support groups to strengthen social skills, decrease isolation, provide emotional support, and create opportunities for ongoing natural support.
* Participate in staff and organizational meetings as requested for care coordination.
* Maintain compliance with all organizational policies and procedures.
* Complete wellness and health promotions activities.
* Follow-up with the individual to confirm linkage to Care Coordination, outpatient treatment or other community services.
* Perform additional relevant duties as requested by supervisor/management.
* Completes care plans, progress notes, data reports and other documentation as required.
* Works off site at shelter location(s) as assigned in the metro area.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Hold a high school diploma or high school equivalency.
* Bi-lingual (Spanish/English); strongly preferred.
* NYS Certified Recovery Peer Advocate certification is required. Provisional certification accepted.
* will be accepted within 12 months to obtain full certification.
* Must obtain Mandated reporter (2 hours) prior to hire date.
* Website info: https://nysmandatedreporter.org/TrainingCourses.aspx
* Obtain within thirty days of hire:
* Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment
* CRPA Canon of Ethics (6 hours)
* Confidentiality related to 42CFR (3 Hours)
* Must be trained in Trauma Informed Care and in Military and Veteran’s culture, or complete training within 1 month of employment.
* Experience or desire to work with people who have a substance use disorder and mental illness.
* Positive attitude and professional demeanor.
* Ability to complete work independently as well as in collaboration with team members.
* Must be team oriented with a willingness to be flexible and helpful.
* Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Windows, Excel, PowerPoint, and electronic communications tools: internet and email.
* Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing.
* Highly organized, motivated self-starter.
* Excellent time management skills.

**\\*Acacia Network is an equal opportunity employer\\***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Experience:

* Addiction counseling: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certified Recovery Peer Advocate Certificate (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Youth Development Leader

The YMCA of Central and Northern Westchester is a charitable, not-for-profit organization serving 66 zip codes in Putnam and Westchester counties. The YMCA of CNW is committed to youth development, healthy living, and social responsibility.

title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist
description:
**Job Description:** 

About us:

About Universal Healthcare Resources (www.universalhcr.org)

Welcome to Universal Healthcare Resources, where excellence in healthcare meets a commitment to compassionate and personalized patient care. At Universal Healthcare Resources, we are dedicated to fostering an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and the well-being of our patients and staff. As a leading healthcare organization, our mission is to provide high-quality healthcare services across diverse communities.

Mission:

Our mission at Universal Healthcare Resources is to deliver exceptional and comprehensive healthcare services that prioritize the unique needs of each individual. We strive to contribute to the health and well-being of the communities we serve, guided by principles of compassion, integrity, and excellence.

Core Values:

1. Patient-Cantered Care: We prioritize the health and satisfaction of our patients, tailoring our services to address their individual needs.

2. Innovation: We embrace innovation in healthcare, staying at the forefront of industry advancements to provide the best possible care to our patients.

3. Collaboration: We believe in the power of collaboration, fostering strong partnerships with our healthcare teams and the communities we serve.

Career Opportunities:

At Universal Healthcare Resources, we recognize that our success is driven by the dedication and expertise of our staff. We offer exciting career opportunities for passionate and qualified individuals who share our commitment to delivering exceptional patient care.

Join us on our journey to make a positive impact in the healthcare industry. If you are seeking a fulfilling career in an organization that values diversity, inclusivity, and professional growth, explore our current job openings and consider joining Universal Healthcare Resources.

Universal Healthcare Resources is an equal opportunity employer, promoting diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities for all qualified applicants.

Here is a job listing based on the provided details:

**Clinical Laboratory Scientist - Traveler**

**Location: Dover, NJ, 07801**  
**Position Type: Limited-Service Laboratory**  
**Shift: Evening and Night Shifts**

**Position Overview:**

We are seeking a highly skilled Clinical Laboratory Scientist (Traveler) to join our team at our Dover, NJ facility. This role requires a versatile and experienced generalist who is proficient in Chemistry, Hematology, Coagulation, Urinalysis, and Blood Bank procedures. The position is designed for a professional who can work independently, especially during the night shift.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform routine and specialized laboratory tests in the areas of Chemistry, Hematology, Coagulation, Urinalysis, and Blood Bank.
* Operate and maintain laboratory equipment according to established procedures.
* Analyze test results, interpret data, and report findings accurately and promptly.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant safety and quality standards.
* Work independently during night shifts, managing the laboratory without direct supervision.

**Shift Details:**

* **Evening Shifts:** 3 shifts per week from 14:00 to 22:30.
* **Night Shifts:** 2 shifts per week from 22:00 to 06:30, including every other Saturday and Sunday.
* **Off Days:** 1 day off per week and every other weekend off.

**Qualifications:**

* Valid BLS certification.
* Current and unrestricted Clinical Laboratory Scientist license/certification.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience as a generalist in a clinical laboratory setting.
* Ability to work independently, particularly during night shifts.

**Compensation:**

* Pay Rate: $41 per hour.

Job Types: Contract, Travel healthcare

Pay: $35.00 - $41.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Medical Specialty:

* Hematology

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift
* Rotating weekends
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Phlebotomy: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* CNA (Preferred)
* Certified Medical Assistant (Preferred)
* Medical Technologist (Preferred)

title: ZO Ambassador
description:
Tishman Speyer creates vibrant destinations and dynamic environments that inspire innovation and connected communities. As a diversified developer, operator, and investment manager of top-tier real estate in 33 markets across the globe, our business choices are driven by the belief that real estate should unlock human potential. Tishman Speyer’s diversified portfolio spans market rate and affordable residential communities, premier office properties and retail spaces, industrial facilities, and mixed-use campuses. We create state-of-the-art life science centers through our Breakthrough Properties joint venture, and foster innovation through our strategic proptech investments. By combining global perspective with local expertise, and a personalized approach, we are able to anticipate our customers’ evolving needs. We were the first real estate company to introduce asset-wide amenity services through our ZO platform, and the first traditional real estate company to create its own flexible space and coworking brand, Studio.
Since our founding in 1978, Tishman Speyer has acquired, developed, and operated 522 properties, totaling 218 million square feet, with a combined value of over $129 billion (U.S.). Tishman Speyer currently has approximately $68 billion in assets under management, including iconic properties such as Rockefeller Center in New York City, The Springs in Shanghai, TaunusTurm in Frankfurt, and Mission Rock in San Francisco.
About ZO
ZO was launched to provide a comprehensive suite of community, wellness, and lifestyle offerings to customers and their employees. At The Spiral, ZO operates a premium hospitality space exclusively for those who work in the building. The ZO Clubhouse will hold events and programming, offer a comprehensive food and beverage program, provide health and wellness classes, and host private events.
Our priority is to create a hospitable, welcoming, and engaging environment that our customers are excited to used when they come to work each day.
Summary of Position
As a ZO Ambassador and Hospitality Assistant for the Amenities at The Spiral, you’ll be responsible for establishing a warm, hospitable and inviting environment for customers visiting the space by performing hosting duties for the lounge area and onsite restaurant.
Key Responsibilities
ZO Clubhouse* Oversee daily restaurant reservations through Open Table & maintain a seating chart and table turnover
* Escorting customers to their table & provide menus and/or offer water if needed
* Respond to any inquiries or concerns via email or phone in a timely & efficient manner
* Assists ZO ambassadors & restaurant staff as needed in dining flow, programmed & private events
* Provide a proactive, warm service that goes above and beyond to keep our customers happy
* Staffing the front reception and receiving guests to the space throughout the day, including providing warm, attentive greeting, ensuring requests are accommodated and coordinating with onsite restaurant group for a seamless experience
* Ensuring the full amenity space is orderly and clean and enter work orders as necessary
* Interacting with guests in the space
* Communicating and resolving any member service issues, with oversight by the Amenity General Manager
* Communicating events to tenants, and checking tenants in/out of programming held at Clubhouse
* Assisting Amenity General Manager and Ambassadors with ensuring event and service content on the ZO app for the property is up to date
* Assist with special projects, tasks, or side duties assigned by GM, AM, or Ambassadors


Private Events* Support event execution for full space buyouts as requested including warm welcome and troubleshooting
* Develop complete understanding of expectations for each private event
* Assist GM and Events Manager is setting up/breaking down by communicating with cleaning team
* Assist ZO ambassadors when needed to ensure full execution of the event as per client requests
* Address guest feedback promptly and loop in the Events Manager when needed


What we look for:
The individual must possess the above knowledge, skills and abilities and be able to explain and demonstrate that he or she can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation, using some other combination of knowledge, skills, and abilities.
Qualifications:* High school diploma or equivalent required
* Experience in hospitality, food service, barista/bartender, or space operations a plus
* Due to the nature of the role this position requires onsite presence Monday through Friday from 12:00 pm to 8:30 pm EST, hours are subject to change based on events
* Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds on a regular and continuing basis
* Must be able to stand and exert well-paced mobility for up to 8 hours in length
* Must be able to bend, stoop, squat and stretch to fulfill cleaning tasks


Critical Competencies for Success:* Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication and multitasking skills
* Passion for working with people, creating amazing experiences, and leading with hospitality
* Takes initiative and is a proactive contributor always focused on continuous improvement
* Attention to the small details, ensuring quality and standards are never compromised
* Eager to be a part of a fast-paced and dynamic work environment


Community-Focused Requirements:* You aim to surpass expectations, not just get the job done but go above and beyond
* You are a pioneer that thinks out of the box to foster creativity and innovation, and are not afraid to take risks
* You are always asking yourself and others how we can make things better and actively seeking out feedback to improve your own performance, your team, and the community
* You will roll up your sleeves because no task is too big or too small – you are team player and willing to help with any task
* You put your customers and team first and make decisions in their best interest. You do what is right and act with integrity and honesty
* You find a way to make the member happy in each interaction so they walk away with a smile
* You make great effort to build relationships with the entire Studio community including members, fellow ambassadors, partners, vendors, and building management


The above information is general in nature and level of work expected; it is not intended to be interpreted as an inclusive list of all duties, responsibilities and qualification required of employees assigned to this role.
The base compensation range for this role is $22.00 to $25.00 per hour. This role is also eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, as well as access to our comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, life and disability insurance, 401(k) plan (with matching contributions), wellness benefits and all other benefits afforded to full-time Tishman Speyer employees.
This base range reflects a number of factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, skill sets, and/or licensure required of an individual in this particular role. The base range is also specific to members of Tishman Speyer’s New York team, as we’ve considered factors specific to this geography.  

*Tishman Speyer is an equal opportunity affirmative action employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, protected veteran status or military status, or any other category protected under applicable law. Tishman Speyer is committed to taking affirmative steps to promote the employment and advancement of minorities, women, persons with disabilities and protected veterans.**Disability Assistance* *- Tishman Speyer is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by sending an email to* *RecruitingAccommodations@tishmanspeyer.com*

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Job Title:** **Administrative Assistant**

**Location: New York**

**Position Type:** **Contract**

**Job Summary:**

The Administrative Assistant will provide comprehensive administrative support to the [Department Name] at [Hospital Name]. This role requires a high level of organization, professionalism, and confidentiality. The Administrative Assistant will perform various tasks including managing schedules, handling communications, maintaining records, and coordinating departmental activities to ensure efficient and effective operations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Office Management:** Manage daily office operations, including ordering supplies, maintaining office equipment, and ensuring a clean and organized workspace.
* **Scheduling & Coordination:** Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and events for the department. Prepare agendas, take minutes, and follow up on action items.
* **Communication:** Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external communications. Answer phones, respond to emails, and handle correspondence in a timely and professional manner.
* **Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate and up-to-date records, files, and databases. Ensure that all documentation is filed and stored securely and is easily accessible when needed.
* **Data Entry:** Enter and update patient and departmental information in relevant databases with a high degree of accuracy.
* **Financial Management:** Assist with budget tracking, processing invoices, and handling expense reports. Ensure that financial records are accurate and up-to-date.
* **Patient Interaction:** Greet and assist patients and visitors, ensuring a positive experience. Handle patient inquiries and direct them to the appropriate department or personnel.
* **Compliance:** Ensure compliance with hospital policies and procedures, as well as relevant regulations. Assist in the preparation of reports and documentation for audits and inspections.
* **Support to Medical Staff:** Provide administrative support to doctors, nurses, and other healthcare professionals, including preparing documents, managing correspondence, and coordinating care activities.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $21.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

Work Location: On the road

title: Accounts Receivable Analyst
description:
Arcadis is seeking an Accounts Receivable Analyst to join our team in New York and New Jersey.


Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets.


We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.


**Role description:**

As the **Accounts Receivable Analyst** will provide assistance to the Grant Billing and Accounts Receivable Manager for all grant and contract invoicing, reporting, and related billing compliance.


**Role accountabilities:**

* Ability to articulate and influence client decisions
* Manage and oversee the grant billing and drawdown schedule
* Partner with GDC senior management to set up, implement, manage, and close out grant financial activities in alignment with GDC and Federal Transit Administration (FTA) and Federal Railway Administration (FRA) standards and requirements
* Assist with maintaining and improving systems for grant compliance
* Work with the GDC Project Managers to oversee data management of grant expenditure tracking for GDC’s Finance department
* Work with the Comptroller on Accounts Receivable management, analysis, and reconciliation of revenue accruals and deferred contract revenues
* Maintain expertise on federal agencies' funding requirements
* Assist the Director of General Ledger and Financial Reporting with developing, implementing, and managing cost allocation schedules and staffing position control logs
* Work closely with program directors and Accounts Payable to help bridge gaps between programs office and finance
* Assist in collection, validation and correlation of invoice backup package for Grant reimbursement

**Qualifications & Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in business or accounting required. Must be detail oriented.
* Possess 4+ years of federal and state grant billing experience preferred.
* Experience with The Federal Transit Administration’s Transportation Award Management System (TrAMS) and Electronic Clearing House Operation – Web (ECHO-Web) systems, preferred.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
* Grants Financial reporting experience preferred
* Experience with audits preferred

Why Arcadis?


We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.


Together, we can create a lasting legacy.


Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging


We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Women, minorities, people with disabilities and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. We are dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by law.


Arcadis offers benefits for full time and part time positions. These benefits include medical, dental, and vision, EAP, 401K, STD, LTD, AD&D, life insurance, paid parental leave, reward & recognition program and optional benefits including wellbeing benefits, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement. We offer nine paid holidays and 15 days PTO that accrue per year. The salary range for this position is $108,000 - $158,000. Actual salaries will vary and are based on several factors, such as experience, education, budget, internal equity, project and location.


Join Arcadis. Create a Legacy.

title: IT Project Manager
description:
Arcadis is seeking IT Project Manager to join our team in New York and New Jersey.


Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets.


We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.


**Role description:**

Arcadis is seeking an experienced **IT Project Manager** to oversee and coordinate all IT-related aspects of a significant tunnel project in the New York / New Jersey area. This position offers an exciting opportunity to lead IT initiatives for a transformative tunnel project, leveraging your technical expertise and project management skills to drive successful outcomes. Join our team and contribute to delivering innovative solutions in infrastructure development **. This role requires a strong technical background in engineering or construction, coupled with expertise in project management information systems (PMIS) and IT project management. The ideal candidate will ensure the technical team adheres to plans and schedules while effectively managing the implementation and operation of PMIS.**

**Role accountabilities:**

* Manage and coordinate the implementation, operation, and optimization of Project Management Information Systems (PMIS) for the tunnel project.
* Develop comprehensive project plans, schedules, and resource allocation strategies for IT implementations, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.
* Monitor and oversee the execution of IT project plans, ensuring tasks are completed on time, within budget, and according to quality standards.
* Provide regular updates and reports on project progress, milestones, and issues to project stakeholders, including management and technical teams.
* Collaborate with IT teams, engineers, and construction personnel to understand project requirements and integrate IT solutions effectively.
* Ensure PMIS system functionality meets project needs, including configuration, customization, and user training as required.
* Manage vendor relationships and contracts related to IT systems and services, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met.
* Implement and enforce IT security protocols and best practices to protect project data and systems.
* Lead and facilitate project meetings, workshops, and training sessions related to IT systems and project management tools.
* Proactively identify risks, issues, and opportunities for improvement in IT processes and systems, implementing solutions to mitigate risks and enhance project efficiency.

**Qualifications & Experience:**

* Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT project management, preferably in engineering or construction environments.
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology , Computer Science, Engineering, a related field or equivalent work experience.
* Proven experience with Project Management Information Systems (PMIS) implementation and management.
* Strong technical background with knowledge of IT infrastructure, systems integration, and software development lifecycle (SDLC).
* Excellent project management skills, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and resource management.
* Effective communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Leadership qualities with the ability to motivate and manage cross-functional teams.
* Familiarity with IT security protocols and best practices.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent.
* Experience with PMIS tools such as Primavera P6, eBuilder, Procore, or similar systems.
* Previous experience in managing IT projects for large-scale infrastructure or construction projects.
Why Arcadis?


We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.


Together, we can create a lasting legacy.


Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging


We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Women, minorities, people with disabilities and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. We are dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by law.


Arcadis offers benefits for full time and part time positions. These benefits include medical, dental, and vision, EAP, 401K, STD, LTD, AD&D, life insurance, paid parental leave, reward & recognition program and optional benefits including wellbeing benefits, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement. We offer nine paid holidays and 20 days PTO that accrue per year. The salary range for this position is $200,000 - $245,000. Actual salaries will vary and are based on several factors, such as experience, education, budget, internal equity, project and location.

title: Production Associate
description:
Position Summary:
The Binding Operations Coordinator is responsible for the binding process of insurance policies, ensuring adherence to underwriting guidelines and regulatory standards. The role includes inputting necessary information into underwriting applications for accurate policy rating, documentation, and issuance. They act as a liaison between underwriters and brokers, responding to inquiries, collecting information for quoting, and providing revised quotes. They also serve as backup for underwriters and underwriting assistants during their absence.
Location:
New York - New York - 1166 Ave of Americas
What will your job entail?
Responsibilities:
Assists the process of binding insurance policies, ensuring accuracy and compliance with binding underwriting guidelines and regulatory requirements.
Administers underwriting applications with the information necessary to rate, document and issue accurate and compliant policies.
Assists with new business submission with directions from the Binding Underwriter to prepare and market to carrier.
Coordinates between Underwriters and brokers by responding to inquiries, works with brokers to obtain information needed to quote, and provides revised quotes as requested.
Processes and issues policy endorsements, including changes to coverage, limits, or policy terms, ensuring accuracy and timely implementation and tracks cancellation notifications, non-renewal, and renewal solicitation notifications.
Maintains comprehensive and organized records of all binding transactions and related documentation, including policy details, endorsements, and client information.
Communicates with clients to collect required information, explains policy terms and conditions, and addresses any questions or concerns related to the binding process.
Executes the work assigned by underwriters and underwriting assistants when they are out of the office or otherwise unavailable.
Prepares reports related to policy binding metrics, performance, and compliance, providing insights for process improvement.
Work Experience:
Minimum of 1 year of work experience in Insurance Industry or Binding Underwriting or related field.
Education:
Bachelor’s degree required; Business Administration, Business Operations and Sales preferred. Any other related discipline or commensurate work experience considered.
Licenses & Certifications:
Prescribed: Minimum requirements for state P&C and/or surplus line licenses
Preferred: Certified Insurance Counselor (CIC) (Preferred)

title: Guest Service Sales Associate!
description:
LOVE TO HELP OTHERS LOOK AND FEEL GORGEOUS? JOIN OUR TEAM AT EUROPEAN WAX CENTER of **GREAT NECK (located in Great Neck Gardens)**~ Are you passionate about people and beauty? Are you naturally confident and outgoing? Does the idea of earning excellent commission drive you? If so, you need to join our team! Turn your passion into a rewarding role with our growing team at European Wax Center!

We're in the business of Revealing Beautiful Skin, and with your help, we'll give guests a reason to walk in, and strut out. Here’s why you should come work with us: **We believe that happy employees make happy guests, so you can expect a fun, upbeat, flexible work environment.**  We believe work should be interesting, so we’ll help you continuously develop new skills. **We believe in promoting from within, so you’ll have opportunities for advancement. Here’s what you need to bring to the table:**

* ***An upbeat attitude & committed to delighting our guests and—of course—having fun while being awesome!***
* Educating guests on the benefits of waxing and our wax packages.
* Scheduling and confirming appointments and managing guest flow throughout the day. **Ability to work in a fun, fast-paced environment.**
* Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends because that’s when we’re busy.
* ***Availability to work one weekend shift and 1 closing shift a MUST***

As a ***Guest Service/Sales Associate***, you'll have the drive and dedication to hit the ground running. Our comprehensive training will provide you with all the tools you will need and to show our appreciation, we offer great pay and performance incentives throughout your career! Benefits: **Complimentary unlimited brow waxing, as well as discounts on all other services & retail products.**  **Hourly wage plus commissions & bonuses**  Flexible schedule – full and part-time. **Career growth**

title: Cake Decorator/Baker
description:
Job Title: Cake Team Member  
Reports to: General Manager

With a projected 1,000 cafes in the United States by 2030, Paris Baguette is one of the fastest-growing neighborhood bakery cafés in the world. Paris Baguette’s mission is to bring expertly crafted baked and brewed goods through a warm and welcoming bakery café experience that delivers joy to everyone.

At Paris Baguette, we serve up graciousness and are happy to put the needs of others first. We are attentive and accommodating to our guests and to each other. We mix in a little love, comfort and compassion into our work every step of the way. We work diligently with a dedication to quality at our core, taking ownership of our actions and decisions. We hold ourselves accountable to our word. We face challenges head on, and when the bar is set high, we have the conviction to clear it with confidence. We pour our heart into everything we do.

It is why pastries to us are not just a product, they are our passion. And why our bakers, cakers, sandwich team members and baristas go further every day to perfect their craft, serving up freshly-baked breads, delicious coffee and cakes more than worthy of their pedestals.

If you are someone who has heart, wants to spread joy and is ready to rise to the occasion, we are looking for you to join our growing team!

-------

WHAT WE ARE HUNGRY FOR  
Our Cake Team Members are true masters of their crafts. The quality and beauty of their creations are second to none.

That level of quality and commitment to excellence is found in everyone who works with us. This candidate will be responsible for ensuring the confectionary execution of all cakes, pastries and desserts. Our ideal Cake Team Member will have a passion for decorating and producing cakes in order to bring a smile and satisfaction to our guests!

KNOWLEDGE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Responsible for scaling, decorating and producing of all Desserts, Pastries and Cakes
* General knowledge of production methods and organization of Confectionary production
* Learn new products and skills and has ability to demonstrate proper techniques to new cakers
* Sanitization procedures, maintaining overall cleanliness of work station
* Must be able to manage time and skills with strong organization
* Knowledge of all recipes and procedures of all production
* Ensure cake display is presentable for internal and external customers
* Make creams and sauces for cakes and pastries
* Receive, stock, and store food in designated containers and storage areas in an organized manner
* Inform supervisor when equipment is not working properly and manage when food supplies are getting low
* Perform other related duties as assigned

WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE

* Knowledge on food producing process, sanitization, quality program
* Knowledge on food producing technique, food microbiology, and food sanitary safety practice/procedure
* Food safety, food labeling, nutrition related knowledge (include FDA)
* Confectionery/Foods major recommended
* Food Handler’s Certificate, preferred
* Effective communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
* Ability to multi-task
* Multiple priority management abilities
* Feedback is a gift! We can only learn, grow and improve our service if we hear and understand what it is our customers are telling us.
* High emotional intelligence with the ability to work with, and manage diverse teams by being highly empathetic, intuitive, self-motivated and driven.
* Teams Win! Has to be a team player who fosters a collaborative and engaged teamwork environment.
* Being a Brand Ambassador, with an excellent knowledge of and commitment to Paris Baguette’s Mission, Vision,

Brand Values and Culture.

SWEET BENEFITS

* Flexible work schedule
* Competitive compensation
* Discounted meals during your shift
* Free Cake for your Birthday
* Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits for full time employees

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Food provided
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Office Assistant
description:
Catholic Health Physicians Practices strives to deliver clinically excellent medical care to our patients.

We are looking for a Medical Office Assistants who will provide the highest quality of patient care by being an integral part of the clinical team.

***Breast Surgery Practice*** 

**DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Prepares exam rooms for use following protocol including: disinfecting, stocking all rooms, and checking vaccinations and medications availability for the day.
* Preps the patient chart with pre-visit planning by reviewing the next working day’s schedule and identifying gaps in care. The medical assistant is responsible for ensuring and/or obtaining the last mammogram and breast ultrasound, colonoscopy, immunizations and any clinical studies or consults that are required for that office visit
* Escorts patients to exam rooms. Directs patient flow for maximum efficiency.
* Collects and documents patient information, clinical data and other relevant information such as vital signs, height/weight, allergies, active medication list, chief complaint, pain screen and current symptoms.
* Obtains additional data from patient/significant other, EKG/lab/ diagnostic test results and other historical data. Reports findings to provider, recognizing abnormal findings or changes in condition.
* Confirms and clarifies written orders prior to implementation of delegated tasks.
* Collects, prepares and processes laboratory specimens for on-site and remote-site testing. Tracks and enters results in medical record. Performs quality control for waived testing and log maintenance
* Assist with front office duties: greeting patients, answering phones, and verifying insurances.
* Other duties assigned

**Qualifications:**

* Completion of an accredited Medical Assistant Program or 3+years documented medical assistant experience and completion of the CH Medical Assistant Assessment.
* BCLS training and current certification required from: American Heart Association or American Red Cross.
* Proficiency with care tasks such as phlebotomy, aseptic technique, etc

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.87 - $29.13 per hour

Benefits:

* 403(b)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift

description:
When you join the CCBQ Team, you will have an impact on the lives of many. For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness. Our Clinics are community-based which offer a professional and welcoming environment for both clients and staff. The Clinics provide psychotherapeutic and psychopharmacological therapy, as well as individual, group, family therapy, crisis intervention, medication management, case management and collateral sessions. Our staff members follow an approach to health care that emphasizes wellness, recovery, trauma-informed care, and physical-behavioral health integration. Why you will enjoy being part of our team:1. Competitive Salaries and Benefits 2. High Quality Supervision3. Opportunities for Advancement

STATEMENT OF THE JOB  
The Receptionist Secretary will perform functions to include receptionist, clerical and organizational functions to ensure that the program runs efficiently and that systems are maintained.

* Answering phones, recording staff schedules in reception book, distribution of telephone referrals, following up for missed Doctor Appointments, verifying Medicaid coverage, collection of client fees/maintenance of fee cards, & distribution/logging of Metro cards.
* Responsible for front desk including phone, scheduling intakes, and passing out telephone referrals.
* Enter all staff appointment schedules in reception desk book.
* Manages MD schedule and contacts all no shows.
* Perform clerical duties for staff Psychiatrists such as pulling charts, preparing encounter forms, & making appointment reminder calls to clients.
* Available for other Support functions at the discretion of Management.
* Monitor/maintain waiting room.

QUALIFICATIONS

* High School Diploma or GED required.
* Trained on CERNER/NETSMART
* Flexibility to be assigned to another program site in order to provide support staff coverage.
* Bilingual Spanish/English; Russian/English; Creole/English; Chinese/English; Korean/English speaking preferred but not required.
* Must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
* Able to travel to multiple locations within the five boroughs as needed.

For more information on our organization, please visit our website at: www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

title: Laser Hair Removal Technician
description:
Are you an ambitious individual with a passion for precision and

a desire to help people feel their best? We have an exciting opportunity for a

skilled and enthusiastic\\_ **Laser Hair Removal Technician** \\_to join our dynamic

team! If you have a keen eye for detail, a friendly demeanor, and a commitment

to providing exceptional service, we want you on our team!

**Position:** ***Laser Hair Removal Technician***

**About Us:**

We are dedicated to empowering our clients to embrace their true

beauty and confidence. As a leader in the industry, we pride ourselves on

offering the latest and most innovative treatments, and laser hair removal is

one of our specialties. Our state-of-the-art facilities, coupled with our team

of highly trained professionals, ensure that each client receives the best care

and achieves their desired results.

**Job Responsibilities:**

As a Laser Hair Removal Technician, you will play a pivotal role

in helping our clients achieve smooth and hair-free skin through safe and

effective laser hair removal procedures.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

title: Math Instructor / Tutor
description:
**Why Work with Us**:  

At Mathnasium of **Mathnasium (ID: 4904401)**, we’re passionate about both our students and our employees! We set ourselves apart by providing **Math Instructor / Tutor**s with:  

* A rewarding opportunity to transform the lives of K-12th grade students
* Consistent, part-time hours after school and on weekends
* A fun, supportive, and encouraging work culture
* Opportunities for advancement
* Continuous training on effective teaching methodologies
* All necessary curriculum and instructional tools

If you are driven, motivated, and eager to make a difference, we would love to meet you!  

  

**What you will do as a Math Instructor / Tutor**:  

* Teach in-center and/or online using the Mathnasium Method™, terminology, and teaching practices
* Work collaboratively with team members to deliver individualized instruction in a group setting
* Assess students’ learning progress and engagement throughout instructional sessions
* Become proficient with digital educational materials and processes

**What we are looking for in a Math Instructor / Tutor:**  

* Passion for math and working with students
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Eagerness to learn and be trained
* Exceptional math competency through at least Algebra I

As part of our hiring process here at Mathnasium, all applicants will be required to take a math literacy test to demonstrate math proficiency.  

  

**Who We Are:** Across North America and all over the world, Mathnasium Learning Centers are committed to teaching children math so that they understand it, master it, and love it.  

Our world-class curriculum is built upon the Mathnasium Method™— the result of decades of hands-on instruction and development — and has changed the lives of children since 2002.  

  

Mathnasium locations are independently owned and operated by franchisees of Mathnasium Center Licensing, LLC ("Mathnasium"). Franchisees are independent business people and not employed by Mathnasium. Thus, each franchisee and each franchisee center is unique and the franchisee is alone responsible for all employment matters in their center. If you are hired to work at a center, the franchisee will be your employer, not Mathnasium.

title: HHA and PCA
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Signing bonus

  

Are you passionate about helping others and looking for a rewarding career that offers flexibility and fulfillment? RES Home Care seeks dedicated and compassionate Home Health Aides (HHAs)or Personal Care Aides (PCAs) to join our team. In this role, you’ll provide essential assistance in daily living and personal care services to patients in the comfort of their homes, all while following an established care plan tailored to their unique needs.  

  

**Why Work with RES Home Care?**  

At RES Home Care, quality care starts with quality caregivers. Our mission is to enhance the quality of life for our patients while providing a supportive work environment for our staff. When you join our team, you can expect:  

* Competitive Pay
* Flexible Schedule
* Full-Time/Part-Time Schedule
* Weekend Shifts
* Paid Time Off
* Sign on Bonus
* Supportive Work Environment
* Referral program
* Continuing Education Credits
* 401K Pension Plan

  

**Home Health Aide/Personal Care Aide Responsibilities/Duties:**
  

As a Home Health Aide, the primary responsibility lies in providing essential assistance with daily living activities and personal care services as outlined in the patient’s established care plan. These tasks may include:  

* Companionship: Offering emotional support and engaging patients in conversation to combat loneliness and isolation
* Daily Living Activities/Household Support
* Meal Preparation & Nutrition: Prepare & provide nutritious meals following dietary restrictions outlined in the care plan
* Personal Care Services
* Mobility Support: Assisting with ambulation and ensuring safety
* Patient Monitoring
* Medication Reminders


  

**Qualifications and Skills:**  

* Home Health Aide (HHA)/Personal Care Aide (PCA) Certification
* Reliable/Dependable
* Previous experience in Home Care, nursing, or caregiving can be beneficial
* Strong Communication Skills, compassionate, and patient
* Ability to work independently while following care plans and instructions
* A commitment to preserving patient confidentiality & adhering to ethical standards
* Flexibility: Must be adaptable to meet the changing needs of patients effectively
* Create a safe environment for clients


  

**HHA/PCA Requirements for Hiring:**  

* Home Health Aide or Personal Care Aide Certification
* 2 Forms of ID, Government ID, Work Authorization, etc.
* Physical Assessment within the last 12 months to include TB Screening (Quantiferon/PPD Testing
* Proof of Immunization of MMR
* Flu & COVID vaccines, if received


  

**Our location is 1461 Lakeland Ave Suite 12 Bohemia, NY 11716. Call (631) 732-4794 to schedule an appointment**  

  

RES Home Care is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Certified P3 Teacher for District Preschool Expansion Program
description:
**Job description**

Are you interested in making a difference in the lives of young children? Come join our team as a teacher working with our 3-year-old children who attend full-day. Espin Preschool is recruiting teachers for our Pre-K 3 children who participate in the Union Township Preschool Expansion program. Our large, beautiful facility serves over 120 children and is located in the downtown Union area, within walking distance to the downtown union center and bus stations. The position is a 10-month. Espin Preschool is searching for individuals who are patient and compassionate to work with our PreK 3 classrooms. We are participants of Grow NJ-rated program that utilizes the Creative Curriculum program, coaching to fidelity, including their Gold Online assessment program. A preschool teacher must have great love and patience for children. **Anticipated start date of September 1st 2024**

**Qualifications:**

* NJ Teacher Certification with P-3 endorsement
* Knowledge of the Creative Curriculum and Gold/Coaching to Fidelity
* Knowledge of Early Childhood Classroom Management and Assessment
* Experience working with preschool students
* Ability to work collaboratively with staff, administration, and families
* Ability to communicate effectively in English, both orally and in writing, with staff, children, parents, and community

By applying to this posting, you are requesting to be considered for a preschool teacher position in our center that is collaborating with the district. You are not applying to Union Public Schools. You will be contacted directly by Espin Preschool, the collaborating preschool.

**Responsibilities**

* Attend to children's basic needs and supervision
* Teach basic skills, such as color, shape, number and letter recognition, personal hygiene, and social skills utilizing our curriculum.
* Establish and enforce rules for behavior and procedures for maintaining order.
* Organize and lead activities designed to promote physical, mental, and social development, such as games, arts and crafts, music, storytelling, and field trips.
* Observe and evaluate children's performance, behavior, social development, and physical health using our online assessment program.
* Identify children showing signs of emotional, developmental, or health-related problems and discuss them with supervisors, parents or guardians, and child development specialists.
* Meet with parents and guardians to discuss their children's progress and needs, determine their priorities for their children, and suggest ways that they can promote learning and development.
* Enforce all administration policies and rules governing students.
* Arrange indoor and outdoor spaces to facilitate creative play, motor-skill activities, and safety in keeping with ECERS standards.
* Maintain accurate and complete student records as required by laws, district policies, and administrative regulations.
* Prepare lesson plans and reports on students and activities as required by the administration.
* Organize and label materials and display students' work in a manner appropriate for their ages and perceptual skills and in keeping with ECERS standards.
* Attend professional meetings, educational conferences, and teacher training workshops to maintain and improve professional competence.
* Confer with other staff members to plan and schedule lessons promoting learning, following approved curricula.
* Supervise, evaluate, and plan assignments for teacher assistants and classroom volunteers.

**Skills**

* Proven experience as a Preschool Teacher
* Excellent understanding of the principles of child development and preschool educational methods
* Familiarity with safety and sanitation guidelines for classrooms
* Excellent communication and instructional skills
* Ability to act as a mediator between children
* Cool-tempered, friendly, and reliable
* Certification in child CPR
* Valid license to practice the profession

**Nice To Haves**

* Able to work with technology in general, including laptops, PCs, IPads, Smart Boards, Apps on iPhones
* Supportive of all individuals and families.
* CPR and first aid

***Why you’ll love working at Espin Preschool:***

At Espin Preschool Learning Center, our mission is to develop a community of confident students who love to learn. We are passionate about creating a nurturing, caring environment where all children can thrive.

We are also committed to the well-being and growth of our teaching staff. We are proud to offer reduced tuition costs for all Espin Preschool members, as well as regular professional development opportunities.

title: Spanish Teacher
Clinician
description:
JOB TITLE: **CLINICIAN** STATUS: FULL TIME - UNION

DEPARTMENT: OPD

REPORTS TO: OPD DIRECTOR

**JOB SUMMARY:** Conduct clinical assessments and provide individual, couples, family and group therapy, as well as crisis intervention. Provide appropriate case management support as well as collaborate with psychiatrists and other team members. Provide appropriate documentation of these services as required by agency policy.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. Provide appropriate clinical services to clients, including assessment, clinical treatment in individual, family or group modality, case management, referrals and discharge planning.

2. Provide documentation, including treatment plans and progress notes, according to agency standards.

3. Communicate with psychiatrists and other clinical staff.

4. Interface with social service counselor and insurance providers as needed.

5. Communicate with collateral contacts, e.g. family, school. Community, medical staff, when necessary.

6. Enter and retrieve information from agency electronic health record.

7. Participate in staff meetings, trainings, in-services, and supervisory sessions

8. Adhere to requirements in General Skills Evaluation

9. Adhere to all VHS Policies and Procedures

10. Perform other duties and responsibilities as requested by VHS management without giving up the right to the grievance process.

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS:**

**EDUCATION:** A Master's Degree in social work, psychology or related field. Individuals with M.S.W's must have New Jersey licensure as a Licensed Social Worker (L.S.W.) and be working towards obtaining hours towards NJ LCSW under the direct supervision of an LCSW.

**EXPERIENCEIKNOWLEDGE:** Minimum of two years related experience in social work, post MSW. Individuals considered for treating specific population must demonstrate two years experience with that population.

Other:

1. Proficient in keyboarding ,computer and word processing skills.

2. Physical: Visual and auditory acuity sufficient to evaluate, treat, and monitor client needs, recognize clients, and maintain accurate records. Fine motor skills for legible written documentation. Ability to work required hours and fulfill job requirements.

3. Must work a flexible schedule inclusive of nights, weekends & holidays in the community, homes & schools.

title: Personal Care Assistant -
description:
**Personal Care Assistant**  

  

We are looking for a compassionate personal care assistant to support clients living with physical, emotional, or cognitive impairments. Your duties will include performing basic housekeeping duties, assisting with personal hygiene, and providing companionship.  

  

To ensure success as a personal care assistant, you should possess experience in a similar role and knowledge of best practices in providing personal care. Ultimately, a first-class Personal Care Assistant will be someone who prioritizes the wellbeing of clients and demonstrates a caring approach.  

  

**Personal Care Assistant Responsibilities:**  

  

* Providing immobile, recovering, or frail clients with support, company, and comfort.
* Assisting with exercise routines as prescribed.
* Reporting changes in the physical, mental, and emotional conditions of clients to relevant parties.
* Providing support with personal hygiene, including bathroom visits, bathing, dressing, and brushing teeth.
* Engaging clients in suitable activities, such as playing games, taking walks, or having conversations.
* Performing basic housekeeping duties, including cleaning, laundry, and preparing meals.
* Assisting clients with household finances, bills, and payments, as well as running errands.
* Accompanying clients on outings and arranging transportation to medical appointments.
* Providing mobility support, including assistance with walking aids and wheelchairs.
* Maintaining a hygienic, tidy, and safe environment.

**Personal Care Assistant Requirements:**  

  

* High school diploma or GED.
* Personal Care Assistant Certification preferred.
* A minimum of two years of experience in a similar role.
* In-depth knowledge of best practices in providing personal care.
* Available to work irregular hours, including night shift, weekends, and holidays.
* Extensive experience in assisting clients with mobility and personal hygiene.
* Ability to perform housekeeping tasks, prepare meals, pay household bills, and run errands.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills, a caring approach, and physically fit.
* Ability to maintain a tidy and safe living environment.

title: Paralegal - Personal Injury
description:
**Job Title:** Personal Injury Paralegal - Spanish Speaking

**Location:** 401 Broadway, New York, NY 10013

**Job Type:** Full-Time

**About Us:** A leading personal injury law firm dedicated to advocating for individuals who have been injured due to negligence or misconduct. We are seeking a skilled and motivated Personal Injury Paralegal to join our dynamic team and support our mission of achieving favorable outcomes for our clients.

**Position Summary:** The Personal Injury Paralegal will work closely with attorneys to assist in the preparation and management of personal injury cases. This role involves conducting drafting documents, managing case files, and communicating with clients and other parties involved in the litigation process. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and a deep understanding of personal injury law.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Case Management:** Assist in the organization and management of personal injury case files, including maintaining case records, tracking deadlines, and ensuring all documents are accurately filed and updated.
* **Drafting Documents:** Prepare and draft legal documents such as pleadings, discovery requests and responses, motions, and settlement agreements. Review and proofread documents for accuracy and compliance with legal procedures.
* **Client Interaction:** Communicate with clients to gather information, provide updates, and address any questions or concerns. Ensure clients are informed about the status of their cases and any required actions.
* **Evidence Collection:** Assist in the collection and organization of evidence, including medical records, accident reports, witness statements, and expert opinions. Coordinate with experts and witnesses as needed.
* **Court Filings:** Prepare and file documents with the court, including ensuring compliance with local rules and deadlines. Prepare exhibits and evidence for trial and hearings.
* **Settlement Negotiation:** Assist attorneys in negotiating settlements with insurance companies and opposing counsel. Prepare settlement documentation and calculations.
* **Administrative Support:** Perform administrative tasks such as scheduling appointments, managing calendars, and organizing case files.

**Qualifications:**

* **Skills:** Excellent organizational and time-management skills. Proficiency in legal research tools and case management software. Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* **Attention to Detail:** High level of accuracy and attention to detail in all tasks and documents.
* **Interpersonal Skills:** Ability to work effectively with clients, attorneys, and other professionals. Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

**Work Environment:** This position will be based in our office. The work environment is professional and supportive, with a focus on collaboration and client-centered service.

**How to Apply:** Please submit your resume, cover letter, and references. In your cover letter, describe your experience in personal injury law and your interest in joining our team.

title: Dental Assistant
description:
Pediatric Dental Assistant needed for our modern, well-established pediatric dental office! Dental Assistants are responsible for providing chair-side support to Dentists and completing prep work so they can more efficiently care for patients. Duties include assisting during dental procedures, taking dental radiographs and digital scans, sterilizing and organizing dental instruments, completing intake paperwork and updating patient records. Experience a plus, but willing to train the right candidate.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Assisting the dentist during a variety of treatment procedures
* Taking and developing dental radiographs (x-rays)
* Taking digital scans/digital impressions
* Asking about the patient's medical history and taking vital signs
* Serving as an infection control officer, following infection control protocol, and preparing and sterilizing instruments and equipment
* Helping patients feel comfortable before, during and after dental treatment
* Providing patients with oral care instructions following surgery and other procedures, such as the placement of a restoration (filling)
* Teaching patients' appropriate oral hygiene strategies to maintain oral health, including tooth brushing, flossing and nutritional counseling
* Taking impressions of patients' teeth for study casts (models of teeth)
* Completing lab work under the direction of the Dentist
* Performing clerical office tasks under the direction of the Practice Administrator
* Communicating with patients and suppliers, which may involve scheduling appointments, answering the telephone, billing and ordering supplies

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* Customer service skills to ensure patients feel comfortable during their appointment as well as well-informed about treatment and dental wellness
* Technical and troubleshooting skills to work with a variety of dental, medical, scheduling and other organization software in the office
* Organization skills enable these professionals to keep their workspace clean to ensure patients, dentists and other assistants are safe and healthy while working
* Knowledge of dental instruments
* Prior experience administering dental X-rays
* Prior knowledge of EagleSoft dental software a plus
* Bilingual English/Spanish a plus

**Education and Experience:**

* NYS Registered Dental Assistant
* Dental Assistant Certificate earned through DANB or certified dental assisting program or trade school
* CPR or BLS Certification

title: Program Supervisor - Adult Day Programs
description:
**About Us:**

The Arc of Essex County is a non-profit organization that provides services and programs for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families. Our corporate office is located in Livingston, NJ and we have programs throughout Essex County.

**Job Summary:**

We are currently seeking a Program Supervisor for our Day Programs. Under the supervision of the Program Manager, the Program Supervisor is responsible for the supervision of the day to day operations of services, while on shift, to include but not limited to the following: providing supports, direct care, medical supervision, staff supervision, skills training and compliance oversight.

This is an in-person position at our Day program locations.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**:

* Provides daily supervision of service functions and activities.
* Coordinates with management staff in developing activities and calendars.
* Develops the daily schedules with staff and consumers assignments.
* ·Ensures that the services are provided in accordance with The Arc of Essex County policies and procedures, as well as state and federal regulations.
* Ensures appropriate medical scripts and medication for individuals are received, administered and stored safely per DDD standards.
* Ensures health and safety of consumers in the vocational services are met in accordance with DDD, state and federal regulations.
* Provides direct care to support consumer needs.
* Supervises direct care staff tasks assigned in accordance with agency policies, applicable laws, and CBA.
* Develops, implements and supervises the completion of goals and objectives stated in the ISP.
* Participates, as directed by the Program Manager, in the ISP process.
* Follows, implements, and supervises all protocol and procedures in accordance with the Day Supports Program Policies & Procedures Manual.
* Maintains a professional relationship with families, Case Managers, guardians, medical care providers, contract providers, and other interested persons.
* Periodically works at other locations as assigned.

**Requirements:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines

**Education / Work Experience / Skills:**

* BA or BS in Special Education, Recreation Management, or Psychology preferred
* At least 1 year of management or leadership experience with individuals with developmental disabilities
* At least 2 years of experience with Program development with ISP/IEP

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Early Careers: Integrated and Global Solutions Internship - Summer 2025
description:
**Create a career that goes in the direction you choose. Get to know opportunity.**

**The Business**

**Create your future.** Operating in the global marketplace means multinational companies face a variety of different business, cultural, language and regulatory environments. Our Integrated and Global Solutions (IGS) business is a team of international and regional consultants who help these companies navigate the challenges of multi-country or multi-line-of-business complexity. In particular, we help large organizations develop complex solutions, often global/cross-border for the design, establishment, financing, operation, oversight and monitoring of their benefit and compensation programs around the world in a manner that meets the needs of both local and headquarter management. In doing so, we work closely with our local offices in other geographies, as well as subject matter experts in other segments.


**Love your work**

As an intern you will be assigned to various client teams to assist in providing consulting advice and services to multinational companies concerning retirement, health and welfare, as well as broader benefits and compensation issues for their operations globally. You will serve as a resource for associates and consultants in charge of engagements by performing many intricate aspects of their client work. You will have immediate exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and present results. These experiences will help build your technical knowledge and overall industry expertise while working in a close-knit environment with a team of experts.


Our interns are eligible for a comprehensive actuarial exam study program including paid study hours, study materials and guidance in working towards attaining an accredited actuarial designation. You will also participate in key learning and development opportunities alongside associates.


The projects you will be exposed to during the internship will give you the opportunity to develop skills and knowledge in the following areas:


* Accounting for pension and benefit costs
* Actuarial valuations for pension and post-retirement benefit plans
* Market conditions in countries around the world
* Benefits due diligence and other support for mergers and acquisitions
* Project management and coordination
* Data collection and analysis
* Communication of results to a non-technical client audience
* WTW proprietary tools and software

  
**About you.**

* Progress towards a bachelor’s or Master’s degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, finance or any other major with significant quantitative course work, with a strong academic record (GPA of 3.0+)
* Ideally you have successfully completed one or more actuarial exams
* Well organized and detail oriented
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to ask the right questions and seek help where appropriate
* Ability to respond to all communications effectively and in a timely manner
* Ability to work both independently and on client teams and enjoy a fast- paced environment
* Sense of accountability; owning one’s work and taking pride in it
* Self-starter: interest in continually challenging oneself and willingness to step outside of one’s comfort zone
* Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program where you will complete all required coursework and receive your degree between December 2025 and June 2027
* Start date is Summer of 2025

**Compensation**

The hourly rate being offered for this role is $27-$36/hr. USD.


This role is also eligible for over-time.


**Company Benefits**

WTW provides a competitive benefit package which includes the following (eligibility requirements apply):


**Retirement Benefits:** Contributory Pension Plan and Savings Plan (401k).


**EOE, including disability/vets**
company_description: At WTW, we provide data-driven, insight-led solutions in the areas of people, risk and capital.
