title: QA Specialist
description:
We are looking for an QA Specialist!!

**POSITION DESCRIPTION**:

We are looking for a detail-oriented quality assurance specialist to maintain QA audits and records to ensure the organization’s quality assurance standards and procedures are met. The quality assurance specialists responsibilities include conducting reviews of patient charts to ensure they comply with the company’s QA standards, identifying issues in the chart and with processes and procedures, and presenting solutions. The quality assurance specialist will also assist in preparing medical records and writing appeal letters. Salary commensurate with experience.

**POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Perform internal audits of staff documentation and programs/levels of care and report on the accuracy, timeliness, and content of the information documented in the patient’s chart.
* Submit deficiencies to appropriate staff and supervisors.
* Perform quality assurance checks of patient charts to ensure medical necessity is being met and that documentation supports reimbursement accuracy.
* Interpret quality assurance standards to ensure quality care to patients by department
* and/or organization wide.
* Document quality assurance activities and audits.
* Collaborate with the medical records department in reviewing patient medical records and utilize clinical and regulatory knowledge and skills along with payer requirements.
* Remain current on regulatory best practices policies, as well as with ongoing compliance issues, provide feedback to appropriate personnel.
* Stay well-informed of industry changes and regulations to ensure adherence and proactive preparedness.
* Administrative tasks such as answering requests for medical records, printing, faxing, and scanning.
* Knowledge of HIPAA, state, and federal confidentiality laws regarding substance abuse and mental health patients and records.
* Ensuring appropriate release of information is on file prior to releasing records.

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS**:

* High school diploma/GED required
* Degree/Certification preferred (LPN, RN, Clinical, Coding, or other related degree) but not required; will consider experience in place of degree.
* Previous experience in quality assurance, compliance, medical records, or a similar field.
* Working knowledge of levels of care, regulatory standards, and concepts of quality assurance as it relates to the documentation of substance abuse and mental health treatment records
* Adaptable, able to perform multiple working tasks at a time when needed.
* Critical thinker, able to conceptualize, apply, analyze, and evaluate information gathered as a guide to validate audit results and correct as necessary.

**KEY SKILLS**:

* Excellent data collection and analysis skills
* High standards of quality, attention to detail, and organization
* Proactive and self-directed
* Ability to work with a team
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Quality assurance/medical records/compliance: 1 year (Required)
* substance use/mental health industry: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Mountainside, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Quality Supervisor
description:
**POSITION TITLE**: Quality Supervisor

**DEPARTMENT**: QA

**REPORTS TO**: Quality Director

**POSITION OBJECTIVE:** The Quality Supervisor is responsible for assisting with company compliance with all Industry and Regulatory requirements.

**RESPONSIBILITES:** 

● Responsible for maintaining the SOP program including issuance and control over files.

● Assist with Investigations including record review, following up with other departments, preparation of reports, and CAPA implementation.

● Assist with Complaint investigations and recalls.

● Responsible for maintaining the Change Control program.

● Assist with Validation protocol generation and execution.

● Responsible for APR generation.

● Responsible for internal audits. Create reports which include evaluation of results and recommendations for improvement.

● Responsible for external audits and vendor qualifications.

● Conduct training, including company-wide QA training for cGMP and SOPs.

● Assist with on-site regulatory and customer inspections.

● Develop and lead continuous process improvements.

● Assist with training, scheduling, and assigning work to staff.

● Maintain current computer database and files.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

● 3-5 years Pharmaceutical Experience with relevant QA focus

● 1-2 years supervisory experience preferred

● Bachelor’s degree preferred

● Experience in the pharmaceutical, food, biotech, or cosmetic manufacturing industry preferred

● Solid knowledge of FDA cGMP regulations

● Self-directed and able to work well independently, as well as in a team environment

● Proficiency with computer and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)

● Excellent reasoning, problem-solving, and writing skills

● Excellent communication skills; ability to effectively articulate quality related issues to all levels of production personnel

**WHAT ALLEGIANT HEALTH OFFERS:**

* Medical and dental insurance
* Vision insurance (paid for by company)
* Life Insurance policy (paid for by company)
* Paid Time Off
* 401(k) with company match

An employee's salary is based on commensurate experience and other qualifications.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the daily work environment is usually moderate and can change during the business day and/or during travel to other company offices

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)

* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Customer Service Manager - State Farm Agent Team Member
description:
Position Overview  

  

Are you outgoing and customer-focused? Do you enjoy working with the public? If you answered yes to these questions, working for a State Farm independent contractor agent may be the career for you! State Farm agents market only State Farm insurance and financial service products.  

  

Responsibilities  

  

* Establish customer relationships and follow up with customers, as needed.
* Provide prompt, accurate, and friendly customer service. Service can include responding to inquiries regarding insurance availability, eligibility, coverages, policy changes, transfers, claim submissions, and billing clarification.
* Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options.

As an Agent Team Member, you will receive...  

  

* Salary plus commission/bonus
* Paid time off (vacation and personal/sick days)
* Valuable experience
* Growth potential/Opportunity for advancement within my agency

Requirements  

  

* Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening
* Self-motivated
* Detail oriented
* Proactive in problem solving
* Dedicated to customer service
* Ability to work in a team environment
* Ability to effectively relate to a customer
* Property and Casualty license (must be able to obtain)
* Life and Health license (must be able to obtain)

If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.  

  

This position is with a State Farm independent contractor agent, not with State Farm Insurance Companies. Employees of State Farm agents must be able to successfully complete any applicable licensing requirements and training programs. State Farm agents are independent contractors who hire their own employees. State Farm agents’ employees are not employees of State Farm.

One State Farm Plaza
Bloomington, IL 61710

$5K Language Differential (applicable based on the need of the clinic & community)

When you join the CCBQ Team, you will have an impact on the lives of many. For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness. The Brooklyn Mobile Crisis Team based out of the Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics provides after-hour coverage to clients in crisis. The team is available 24/7 to respond to clients in crisis. Clients in crisis can call, receive emergency counseling, visits, assistance with the goal of preventing decompensation, hospitalizations, and the use of 911 services. All CCNS Integrated Health and Wellness clients have access to the team for 24/7 assistance.

Why you will enjoy being part of our team:  
1. Competitive Salaries and Benefits  
2. Educational Loan Forgiveness  
3. Professional Development (CEUs)  
4. High Quality Supervision  
5. Opportunities for Advancement

STATEMENT OF THE JOB  
Mobile Crisis Clinician provides support, services and treatments necessary to provide integrated crisis response, crisis stabilization interventions and crisis prevention activities. The Mobile Crisis Clinician is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. The Mobile Crisis Clinician provides timely evaluation, triage and access to acute mental health, developmental disability and/or substance abuse services. Additionally, the Mobile Crisis Clinician provides treatment to ensure symptom and harm reduction and safely guides people in acute crisis to appropriate crisis stabilization and detoxification support/services. These services include immediate telephone response to assess the crisis and determine the risk, mental status, medical stability and appropriate response.  
\\* Providing immediate telephonic response to assess crisis and determine the risk, mental status, medical stability and appropriate response; provide face-to-face response as needed.  
\\* Make referrals for emergency or continuing care or may suggest treatment alternatives to facilitate services in the community in a safe environment.  
\\* Developing a Crisis Plan before discharge for recipients new to the public service system and/or revise existing crisis plan components in Person Centered Plans, as appropriate.  
\\* Monitoring or coordination of movement across levels of care, directly to the person and the family; coordinate discharge planning and community re-entry following hospitalization, residential services and other levels and to assure continuing care.  
\\* Be familiar with TA, Inc. policies and procedures including the securing of emergency services and the regulations concerning medication administration.

QUALIFICATIONS  
\\* Master’s Degree in Social Work or related field from an accredited college or university.  
\\* Must be licensed NYS LMSW or LHMC.  
\\* Must have a minimum of one (1) year of experience in providing crisis management services in the following settings: assertive outreach, assertive community treatment, emergency department or other service providing 24/7 response in emergent or urgent situations.  
\\* Must have two years of prior supervisory experience in the mental health field.  
\\* Requires a combination of skills in the following areas; operational oversight and evaluation of program services and staff, personnel management, public relations, governmental relations, leadership development and team building skills.  
\\* Bilingual Spanish/English; Russian/English; Creole/English; Chinese/English; Korean/English speaking preferred but not required.  
\\* Ability to travel throughout the five boroughs from site to site.  
\\* Able to work flexible hours and days – including weekends/evenings/holidays according to needs of a 24/7 programs.

BENEFITS  
We offer competitive salary and excellent benefits including:

* Generous time off (Vacation/ Personal Days/ Sick Days/ Paid Holidays annually)
* Medical,
* Dental
* Vision
* Retirement Savings with Agency Match
* Transit \\* Flexible Spending Account
* Life insurance
* Training Series and other additional voluntary benefits.

For more information on our organization, please visit our website at: www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

Apply online:

https://us241.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/ccbq/Posting/View/22127

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $84,000.00 per year

title: Membership Sales Manager
description:
**Seven24Collective, a private members club located at Gansevoort Meatpacking Hotel is looking to add an experienced Sales Manager to their team.** 

As a Membership Sales representative, you will play a crucial role in promoting and selling memberships to potential clients. Your primary focus will be on driving membership sales and ensuring customer satisfaction.

**Primary Job Functions:** 

* To meet as many applicants and potential members as possible, providing tours of the Membership Club and facilitating the membership application process
* To promote the Club directly by attending external networking events
* Devise and implement strategies to support the submission of applications to the Club, thus ensuring a strong membership wait list
* Contribute to the creation of member events onsite for the membership community
* Initiate, manage, and run events that will lead to applications of prospective members
* To support with the member on-boarding process, personally meeting all new members and familiarizing them with Club facilities and club culture
* To support operations teams in looking after members on the floor, liaising with f&b managers and servers to ensure a positive experience for members and staff
* To support with the member on-boarding process, personally meeting all new members and familiarizing them with Club facilities and club culture
* To become familiar with all internal membership tools (member portal, digital app, etc.) and train other team members
* To provide support on any other membership-related projects

**Required Skills/Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum three years of experience as a Sales Manager, preferably in private members club setting or hospitality industry
* Engaging personality that captivates loyalty
* Able to deliver luxury service with an intuitive and innovative approach
* Proven track record of achieving and exceeding goals
* Flexibility to work schedules to include evenings, weekends, holidays
* Professional image
* Communicates very well in English, both verbally and with written skills
* Computer Literate (Microsoft Word, Excel, CLS and ACT)
* Selling Skills, which are at minimum above the industry average, this includes but not limited to Xerox, Wilson Learning, Forum, Customer focused sales skill. Incumbents, who have not completed these sales techniques, should be well versed in prospecting, rate and contract negotiating, business planning and telephone sales
* Self-motivated, detail oriented, positive thinker and a team player

* Must be able to work stationary at least 8 hours per day and/or standing for 8 to 10 hour to conduct trade shows.

title: Insurance Staff Position - State Farm Agent Team Member
description:
Position Overview  

  

Successful State Farm Agent is seeking a qualified professional to join their winning team for the role of Insurance Staff Position - State Farm Agent Team Member. We seek an energetic professional interested in helping our business grow through value-based conversations and remarkable customer experience. If you are a motivated self starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, then this is your opportunity for a rewarding career with excellent income and growth potential.  

  

Responsibilities  

  

* Provide prompt, accurate, and friendly customer service. Service can include responding to inquiries regarding insurance availability, eligibility, coverages, policy changes, transfers, claim submissions, and billing clarification.
* Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options.
* Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals.
* Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services.

As an Agent Team Member, you will receive...  

  

* Salary plus commission/bonus
* Health benefits
* Profit sharing
* Paid time off (vacation and personal/sick days)
* Valuable experience
* Growth potential/Opportunity for advancement within my agency

Requirements  

  

* Sales experience (outside sales or inside sales representative, retail sales associate, or telemarketing) preferred
* Successful track record of meeting sales goals/quotas preferred
* Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening
* Enthusiastic about the role insurance and financial products play in helping people manage the risks of everyday life, recover from the unexpected, and realize their dreams
* Self-motivated
* Ability to make presentations to potential customers
* Achieve mutually agreed upon marketing goals
* Experience in marketing
* Property and Casualty license (must have currently)
* Life and Health license (must be able to obtain)

If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.  

  

This position is with a State Farm independent contractor agent, not with State Farm Insurance Companies. Employees of State Farm agents must be able to successfully complete any applicable licensing requirements and training programs. State Farm agents are independent contractors who hire their own employees. State Farm agents’ employees are not employees of State Farm.

title: Assistant Director for Utilization & Case Management
description:
**Assistant Director for Utilization & Case Management** 

BronxCare Assistant Director for Utilization & Case Management reports to the Senior Director and assists the Associate Director of Case Management with daily operations of the department. The Assistant Director is responsible for the day-to-day management of the Utilization Nurses, Case Managers, BH Coordinators, and Financial Investigators. This includes but is not limited to: daily supervision, staff recruitment, retention, labor relations, daily staffing/assignment, employee performance evaluation, performance improvement, staff education, and payroll via KRONOS.

The Assistant Director serves as a resource/mentor for Utilization / Case Managers and other institutional personnel, and participates in the development and implementation of new Institutional initiatives. The Assistant Director provides ongoing education to UM, CM’s, and other hospital personnel as needed. The Assistant Director collaborates with Appeals Management, Patient Access, and other institutional departments to ensure contractual compliance and optimal reimbursement by Third Party Payers. The Assistant Director has a collaborative reporting relationships with Internal Medicine, Family Medicine and attends weekly LOS meetings. Assists Associate Director with Quarterly Performance Improvement and Denials reporting for the Board of Trustees. Responds to patient grievances and staff protest of assignments as needed.

**Responsibilities Duties and Responsibilities:** 

* Attend interdisciplinary rounds on units as warranted.
* Meets with Staff, as warranted, to review medically complex and long-stay cases
* Collaborates with Social Work Supervisors to resolve discharge planning issues
* Regularly reviews avoidable day data and provides follow-up with Staff on accuracy and completeness of avoidable days.
* Oversees Case Manager's and Utilization staff interactions with physicians, nurses, social workers, payers, patients, and families.
* Administrator on Duty on call rotation

**Clinical Leadership:** 

* Develops, implements, and maintains professional standards.
* Ensures that the overall CM program supports patient, unit, and clinical service objectives.
* Provides operational and clinical oversight to case managers to ensure that all day-to-day activity supports the mission of efficient and clinically appropriate patient care.
* Demonstrates integral involvement in the Nursing Department QA/PI program.
* Participates in monthly Nursing Department meetings.
* Works with unit case managers, utilization nurses clinical nurse managers, physicians, and social workers to facilitate Interdisciplinary Rounds to ensure compliance with the patient management plan and the appropriate length of stay for each patient.
* Conducts rounds on the inpatient units as warranted to determine and improve hindrances to appropriate length of stay.
* Collaborates with the Associate Director of Case Management to maintain, review, and update all Case Management specialty policies in accordance with hospital, professional, and regulatory standards.
* Supports the overall strategic goals of the Hospital and the Nursing Department.
* Creates and maintains an environment of care where patients, families, staff, and others are treated with respect, dignity, and in a professional manner, promoting an environment respectful of cultural diversity.
* Attends interdisciplinary rounds as necessary.
* Meets with UR and CM to review medically complex and long-stay cases
* Collaborates with Social Work Supervisors to resolve discharge planning issues
* Regularly reviews avoidable day data and follow-up with Utilization Nurses on accuracy and completeness of avoidable days.

**Qualifications**:

* A Bachelor of Science with a major in nursing is required.
* CCM Certification is preferred.
* Master in nursing or health-related field preferred.
* 3-5 years of applicable nursing utilization review, hospital case management, and charge nurse/supervisory experience.
* Must have relevant clinical competence in an acute care hospital setting
* Familiarity with NYSNA and 1199 union contracts beneficial
* Licensed as a registered nurse with current registration in New York State.

Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, education, and hospital need. The salary range or contractual rate listed does not include bonuses or other forms of compensation or benefits.

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Per Diem/PRN
description:
**REGISTERED NURSE (RN)** 

**POSITION SUMMARY** 

The Registered Nurse (RN) is responsible and accountable for all healthcare aspects delivered in the programs under capacity. The RN will work with staff who support adults with intellectual, developmental and related disabilities in both a community based and residential program setting. RN will provide training to Eleos staff who support individuals with various medical conditions, including seizure disorders, physical disabilities or other identified medical needs.

The RN will provide medical response training, support, assistance and guidance to management and staff to achieve and/or maintain the outcomes of increased independence, productivity, enhanced family functioning and inclusion in the community while ensuring the general well-being of each Individual served. The RN will provide guidance to management and staff to develop or enhance their understanding and skills required for appropriate health & safety practices and procedures.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include but are not limited to:**

* Increase knowledge of staff and client issues by attending and participating in staff development in-service sessions.
* Responsible for planning, designing, and facilitating health training for staff including respiratory, digestive, cardiovascular, etc.
* Work with Management and Staff to coordinate healthcare services, in vetting referrals and reviews at admissions and ensuring departmental healthcare changing needs data is recorded timely, intervenes, or follows through on data statics, metrics, and/or results promptly.
* Oversee the nursing delivery and provide direction, leadership, and oversight to the staff.
* Provide administration, oversight and insight with regards to healthcare monitoring system, service delivery provided to individuals with complex medical needs and medical acuity, compliance with medical follow-up appointments, Medication administration, Specialized trainings and emergency response times.
* Provide and maintain the appropriate medical staff training for staff for individuals with conditions such as respiratory, digestive, cardiovascular, etc.
* Maintain nursing license current as well as CPR/First Aid certification.
* Maintain knowledge and operate with a sense of awareness to operational goals and objectives and fully vested in their implementation to fulfill Eleos’ strategic plan.
* Ensure that the medical training is consistent with agency, state, federal and regulatory guidelines.
* Foster and maintain positive employee/management relations; develop an atmosphere of cooperation and teamwork.
* Train staff members in the use of medical equipment, assistive devices, blood pressure machines, physician orders including medications, monitoring of vital signs and tracking, for Individuals with respiratory, digestive, cardiovascular, etc. conditions.
* Collaborate with management and staff to assure effective communications to enhance the quality of services and meet the program and agency objectives and goals.

**QUALIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS**

* RN must have current and valid registration as a professional nurse in the State of New Jersey and must possess knowledge of the principles, procedures and methods of professional nursing practices.
* 1-3 years of nursing experience (home care experience preferred).
* In home care new client assessment experience is preferred.
* Excellent communication skills, flexible and able to interact positively with the rest of the staff.
* Commitment to regulatory compliance and to submitting all documentation in a timely fashion.
* Experience working with adults with intellectual, developmental, and related disabilities is preferred.
* Ability to demonstrate compassion, excellent communication skills, compliance with professional ethical conduct, demonstration of critical thinking, attention to detail, confidence, adaptability, stamina, and commitment to development.
* Critical care, emergency medicine nursing experience is preferred.
* Excellent assessment skills for admission and discharge as indicated and deemed appropriate. Superior planning and organizational skills.
* Strong level of comfort addressing a group of people in a training environment.
* Ability to intervene in crisis situations and implement crisis management techniques in accordance with agency policies and procedures.
* Competence in functional needs assessment of Individuals’ abilities and health status.
* Ability to perform specialized cognitive assessments utilizing appropriate evidence-based tools.
* Desire to maintain a positive, healthy, and stimulating therapeutic environment for Individuals and service recipients.
* Familiarity with DDD, Medical Acuity Levels preferred.
* Provide clinical evaluation and intervention on arising healthcare related conditions for service recipients.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* Must cooperate with Eleos Family Services and Department of Human Services staff in any inspection, inquiry or investigation.
* Must be 21 years of age or older.
* Must consent to and pass State/Federal Criminal Background and Central Registry checks.
* Must consent to and complete drug testing (when applicable).
* Must be willing to learn requirements by the Division of Developmental Disabilities and Eleos Family Services.
* Must be willing to acquire knowledge of all OSHA, DDD, CMS, CARF, Residential Office of Licensing N.J.A.C. 10:44A Standards for Community Residences, Adult Day Habilitation Certification standards and other external regulations and requirements.
* Must have excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational and computer skills.
* Flexible and able to work independently and part of a team.
* Must have or obtain CPR and Standard First Aid Certification.
* Valid driver’s license. (not to exceed 5 points)

**SHIFT & SCHEDULE**

* Per diem/PRN

**LOCATION**

* Hybrid – Remote, In-Person Training

Job Types: Contract, PRN, Per diem

Pay: $40.00 - $45.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 10 per week

Benefits:

* Travel reimbursement

Experience:

* Nursing: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

title: Receptionist (Bilingual - English / Spanish)
description:
**About Us:**

Salenger, Sack, Kimmel & Bavaro (SSKB) is a leading law firm experienced in medical malpractice, personal injury, construction accidents, and product liability. We are committed to providing exceptional legal services and ensuring our clients receive the support and representation they deserve. We’re looking for an enthusiastic and empathetic individual to join our team as a Receptionist.

**Job Summary of the Receptionist:**

As the first point of contact for our clients and visitors, the Receptionist plays a critical role in creating a positive and welcoming atmosphere at our firm. We are looking for someone with a friendly demeanor, excellent communication skills, and a strong sense of professionalism. This role involves managing the front desk, handling phone calls, and providing administrative support to ensure the smooth operation of the office.

**Key Responsibilities of the Receptionist:**

● **Greet and Welcome:** Provide a warm and friendly welcome to clients, visitors, and staff, ensuring they feel comfortable and valued from the moment they enter the office.

● **Answer and Direct Calls:** Handle incoming phone calls with a polite and professional tone, directing them to the appropriate staff members or departments.

● **Client Interaction:** Maintain a positive and empathetic attitude in all client interactions, both in-person and over the phone.

● **Schedule Appointments:** Manage and coordinate appointment schedules for attorneys and staff, ensuring efficient use of time and resources.

● **Administrative Support:** Assist with various administrative tasks such as sorting mail, managing office supplies, and preparing documents.

● **Maintain a Tidy Reception Area:** Ensure the front desk and reception area are always clean, organized, and presentable.

● **Handle Inquiries:** Respond to general inquiries about the firm’s services with knowledge and professionalism.

**Qualifications:**

● **Experience:** Previous experience in a receptionist, administrative assistant, or customer service role is preferred.

● **Personality:** Friendly, approachable, and empathetic with a strong customer service orientation. A natural people-person who enjoys interacting with others and making them feel welcome.

● **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a clear and pleasant phone manner.

● **Professionalism:** Demonstrates a polished, professional appearance and demeanor at all times.

● **Organization:** Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently and effectively.

● **Adaptability:** Able to handle unexpected situations with grace and remain calm under pressure.

● **Technology:** Proficient in using office equipment, phone systems, and basic computer software (e.g., Microsoft Office Suite).

*Salenger, Sack, Kimmel & Bavaro, LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, age, religion, ancestry, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, disability or handicap, marital and partnership status, arrest or criminal conviction record, status as a victim of domestic violence, genetic information (including predisposing genetic characteristics), military/veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Our management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities and general treatment during employment.*

title: Mental Health Counselor
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT) to join our team!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, and Rockville Center locations.**

Full-time is considered to be 38 client hours per week including 3 evenings, or 2 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

Part-time work is considered to be a minimum of 20 hours per week including 2 evenings.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full-time staff
* Reimbursement funds for professional development training / CEU
* Paid Family Leave
* All employment taxes processed by Nassau Psychology
* Workers Comp & State Unemployment insurance provided
* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

We are seeking a dedicated Front of House Manager to join our Cloudy Donut team. The ideal candidate will oversee all front-of-house operations, ensuring excellent customer service and efficient restaurant performance.

THIS CANDIDATE MUST HAVE A VALID LICENSE AS YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO TRANSPORT THE DESSERTS FROM OUR BAKERY TO OUR SECOND LOCATION IN THE CITY.

\\*Duties\\*

-Glaze Donuts and prep rack for transportation, for which you will be responsible for transporting the donuts from our Brooklyn Heights location to our store in Manhattan

-Return to manage and work the front of house

- Ensure exceptional customer service and resolve any guest issues or complaints

- Coordinate with the kitchen staff to ensure timely food delivery

- Oversee restaurant cleanliness and maintenance

- Train new employees on bakery procedures and standards

- Monitor inventory levels for front-of-house supplies

- Implement strategies to increase sales and improve overall guest experience

\\*Qualifications\\*

- Previous experience in team management within the food industry

-Valid License and a vehicle that can transport a small donut rack

- Strong knowledge of food and restaurant management

- Proficiency in interviewing and training staff

- Familiarity with Clover POS system is a plus

- Understanding of kitchen management and food production processes

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, quick-service fast-food restaurant environment

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Please do not apply for this position if you do not have a valid drivers license this is a requirement, not a negotiation.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $600.00 - $1,000.00 per week

Expected hours: 50 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* One of your new employees often gets flustered when customers are angry. You've tried giving her advice, but she isn't improving.

What would you do?  
A. Have her role-play angry customer scenarios with a senior employee  
B. Ask a senior employee to watch her performance and give her feedback  
C. Instruct her to transfer angry customers to more experienced employees  
D. Suggest that she review the training manual more thoroughly  
E. Closely monitor her performance and intervene to take calls when needed

* You're traveling in the same direction as a school bus. It's in the lane next to you and is a few car-lengths ahead of you. The bus starts to slow down and turns on its red flashing lights.

What would you do?  
A. Stop to wait for the lights to stop flashing  
B. Speed up to get past the bus before it stops  
C. Honk the horn to notify the driver that you're passing  
D. Continue at the same speed to pass the bus before it stops

* Which practices are critical to ensuring food safety in a restaurant kitchen? Select all that apply.

A. Regularly calibrating the thermometers used to check food temperatures  
B. Implementing a first-in, first-out system for all food items in storage  
C. Regularly retraining kitchen staff on cross-contamination prevention  
D. Allowing cooked foods to cool at room temperature before refrigeration to minimize temperature shock  
E. Issuing reusable gloves for food handlers to wear at all times

title: Head Chef
description:
***To participate in, coordinate and oversee the preparation of food for patients, Food & Nutrition staff, and for special functions.***

**Hours: During the week: 6:30AM-2:30PM, Weekends: 5:30AM-1:30PM (every other weekend)**

***May have to work an evening shift once in a while to oversee cooks.*** 

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:**

**Education:**

* High School Diploma or GED
* Culinary Degree

**Licensure/Certification**:

* Serve Safe Certification preferred
* 120- hour Dietary Managers Course preferred

**Skills, Knowledge or Abilities**:

* Ability to create, scale, follow and implement standardized recipes.
* Basic culinary skills including knife skills and basic cooking techniques.
* Compliance with regulatory standards and practices, including sanitation.
* Basic Computer skills: Microsoft Word and Excel knowledgeable.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Position requires standing on feet for long periods of time
* Must be able to bend, reach, stretch and lift heavy equipment and supplies

**Experience:**

* At least two years’ experience cooking in a healthcare setting

**DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Directs, engages in and is responsible for the overall preparation of food for patients, staff and special functions. Demonstrate organizational skills for efficient meal production.
* Oversees cooks on all shifts in the production of resident meals.
* Maintains a neat, clean, and safe work environment at all times. Ensures that high standards of operation, safety and infection prevention and control are met. Ensures self and staff use appropriate body mechanics to lessen the risk of injury.
* Ability to assume full charge of the Food Service Department in the absent of Food Production Manager, Food Service Supervisor and/or Food Service Director.
* Effectively assembles ingredients following standardized, approved recipes. Inspects food for quality, appearance and taste. Ensures the proper storage, rotation and holding of food. Communicates to the Food Production Manager when there are issues or concerns with food utilization, specifications, pack or portion size, and product yield.
* Ensures staff adheres to department policies and procedures regarding food handling and preparation.
* Provides meals and services that reflect an understanding of cultural and religious diversities. Creates and maintains an atmosphere of courtesy and respect towards staff, patients, and family members.
* Coordinates work schedules to ensure meals are served within the appropriate specifications and within the appropriate time frame. Communicates to the Food Production Manager/Director when there are issues or concerns regarding work load, performance or products produced by the cooks.
* Offers ongoing suggestions for improving meal service, including assisting and developing standardized recipes, standardized portion sizes, and menu enhancements and development.
* Conducts training to the culinary staff when recipes or products are changed.
* Assists in ordering food supplies as instructed, including items from our major purveyor, fish, meat and frozen food vendors.
* Assist the department in receiving supplies and maintaining storage areas
* Adheres to dress/uniform policy. Arrives to work properly dressed, well groomed, and neat. Prominently wears Facility ID badge.
* Performs all other related duties as needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $29.00 - $37.50 per hour

* Day shift
* Morning shift

title: Assistant Director of Library
description:
The Assistant Director, under the leadership of the Director of Libraries, supports initiatives promoting student success. In collaboration with the Academic Learning Center, Media Services, Learning Resources, and the Innovation Center, the Assistant Director coordinates projects that encourage UCNJ students and faculty to use library resources and tools to facilitate learning. The Assistant Director also oversees the hiring, training, and scheduling of part-time library staff, facilitates the integration of AI and other advanced technologies, and envisions the library as a multi-functional learning space for the digital future.  


  

**Characteristics, Duties, and Responsibilities**
* Supports the Director in identifying trends, assessing current resources, and positioning the library as a central hub for learning in the digital age.
* Researches and recommends AI-powered tools for improved information literacy.
* Develops strategies to incorporate AI and advanced technologies into library services.
* Coordinates scheduling for all campuses.
* Hires, trains, and supervises the part-time library staff.
* Maintains operations of library technical services and systems.
* Recommends updates to circulation policies, procedures, and operations to the Director.
* Assists the Director with the coordination of projects and events for the libraries.
* Participates in the development and delivery of Library reference, instruction, educational, and cultural programming.
* Prepares library reports as requested by the Director.
* Assists Director with requisitions and the annual budget for the libraries.
* Maintains the Library website, social media presence, and online instructional resources.
* Performs Interlibrary Loan (ILL) duties.
* Serves as liaison to the academic divisions.
* Coordinates Library signage, printing, and publications
* Liaises with Public Safety to resolve security incidents and maintain safety of library environment.
* Communicates with Facilities regarding maintenance and physical plant issues.
* Serves on college committees
* Participates in Library, Learning Resources Division, and College-wide meetings.
* Performs additional duties as assigned.
  

  

**Education Requirements**
Master of Library Science degree from ALA-accredited program required.
  

**Experience**
* 2 years of professional experience in an academic library or library setting and/or a combination of equivalent experience preferred.
* Professional experience in library administration, collection development, acquisitions, serials, and circulation/ILL.
* Experience in library reference and/or instruction.
* Experience in webpage design or Libguides development preferred.
* Knowledge of and experience with integrated library automation systems.
* Ability to use library technology effectively for public access, library instruction, and technical processing.


  

**Competencies and Skills Required**
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Supervisory experience
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to use AI and other advanced technologies.
* Effective use of data to enhance library services.
* Commitment to working with a diverse community.


  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* This position’s duties are normally performed in a typical interior/residence work environment, based on the activity scheduled.
* Some physical effort required; however, the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
* No or very limited exposure to physical risk.
* Some travel required.


  

**Salary** $55,000-$65,000
  

**Additional Information**UCNJ Union College of Union County, NJ does not discriminate and prohibits discrimination, as required by state and/or federal law, in all programs and activities, including employment and access to its career and technical programs.  

  

UCNJ Union College of Union County, NJ is an EEO/AAP Employer/Protected Veteran/Disabled  

  

==============  

  

Disclaimer: This job description outlines the general nature and key features performed by various positions that share the same job classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of all employees assigned to the job. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or re-assign duties to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodations or other business reasons.  

  

==============  

  

We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time faculty and staff which includes Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits. We also offer twenty vacation days, ten paid holidays, and a ten-week summer work schedule which allows the college to close on Fridays. Other additional benefits include gym privileges, tuition remission for credit and non-credit courses at UCNJ Union College of Union County, NJ, and tuition reimbursement for an approved degree program at an accredited college or university.  


  

**Terms of Employment**
Full Time. Flexible schedule to meet department needs. Some evening, weekends, and extended hours will be required. Ability and willingness to travel on short notice to all on and off- campus sites as needed by the college. Mandatory overtime is required throughout the year, especially at peak times. Employee must establish primary residency in New Jersey within one year of appointment unless an exemption applies.

Must possess a valid driver’s license or have reliable means of transportation.

title: Litigation Paralegal
description:
*Shipman’s value lies in our commitment -- to our clients, to the profession and to the community. We have one goal: to help our clients achieve their goals. How we accomplish it is simple: we devote our considerable experience and depth of knowledge to understand each client’s unique needs, business and industry, and then we develop solutions to meet those needs. With more than 140 lawyers in offices throughout Connecticut and New York, we serve the needs of local, regional, national and international clients. Our clients include public and private companies, institutions, government entities, non-profit organizations and individuals.*

Shipman & Goodwin is seeking a full-time Litigation paralegal, to be based in and working from our **Stamford, CT** office. The ideal candidate will be growth-focused and able to work both collaboratively and independently with multiple attorneys and other legal staff on the team.

**Specific responsibilities and duties include:**

* Assist in preparing routine pleadings, motions, and discovery requests and responses
* File and serve exhibits, motions, briefs, and other legal documents with the court and other counsel
* Contact vendors and others to schedule and coordinate meetings and depositions
* Collaborate with various individuals within and outside the firm’s Litigation Department regarding workflow and other issues
* Assist with trial and hearing preparation, including creating trial notebooks, maintaining and tracking exhibits, and coordinating witness schedules
* Organize and manage case files with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring all documents and materials are properly filed and maintained
* Engage with clients to gather information, provide updates, and ensure they have a clear understanding of the status of their matters
* Utilize legal software such as iManage for document management
* Develop and maintain records regarding billable hours spent on specific matters
* Perform other similar or related duties, not specifically included within this position description, but which are consistent with the general level of the responsibilities described

**Qualifications:**

* A minimum of 3 years Litigation Paralegal experience required; experience with both Connecticut and New York practice strongly preferred
* Bachelor’s Degree and/or paralegal certificate from an ABA-approved program are preferred
* Strong communication skills (written and verbal) and client service skills
* Knowledge of, and experience with, preparation and filing of motions, discovery, pleadings, court rules, practices and procedures
* Familiarity with E-filing procedures in state and federal courts, particularly in Connecticut and New York
* Strong attention to detail
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and related software
* Perform in a high-level, fast paced environment with minimal supervision
* Strong work ethic and self-driven attitude, with a willingness to take initiative and be hands-on

Job Type: Full-time

title: Crane Operator - 1st shift $18.50
description:
We are seeking a motivated Crane Operator to join our Southplainfield- Union branch. All employees become memebers of the Union 31 days after the effective date of employment. The position requires working in accordance with Triple-S Steel job requirements and Safe Methods of Work. Overtime hours may be required to meet our customers’ needs.

Responsibilities:

* Follow Triple-S safe methods of work at all times, and immediately advise supervisor of any unsafe conditions.
* Maintain and safely operate tools and equipment as assigned, including but not limited to tape measure, caliper, band saw, forklift, overhead crane and personal protective equipment.
* Lift and carry up to 50 pounds for up to 20 feet to heights of 5 feet; exert 25 to 50 pounds of force frequently and/or 10 to 20 pounds of force constantly to move objects, reach, squat, stand, walk up to 2 miles per day, climb up stairs, ladders and on equipment while wearing required personal protective equipment as necessary.
* Maintain spatial orientation and awareness to safely move around work environment with many moving objects.
* Use clear vision to judge near and far distance to maintain awareness of ongoing work activities of other employees.
* Work indoors and outdoors in all kinds of weather conditions including precipitation, cold/heat, high wind, and turbulent conditions. The Crane Operator will be regularly exposed to the typical weather of the local area.
* Attend all required company meetings.
* Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

* Ability to correctly read and understand work orders and/or receive oral instructions to determine work assignments or material or equipment needs.
* Ability to effectively use basic computer or mobile device applications.
* Demonstrate intermediate math skills (add, subtract, multiply, divide).
* Ability to safely meet or exceed minimum productivity levels established by the Company.
* Ability to effectively plan and organize work activities independent of direct supervision; work alone and in a team environment.
* Develop a good working knowledge of material and inventory control techniques and procedures.
* Ability to maintain ongoing inter-department communications related to routing, safety, and customer relations.

Other:

* Physical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands/fingers to handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.
* Working Conditions: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals and risk of electrical shock when in the operations or laboratory areas. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate, but due to open office environment noise level may occasionally be high.

Disclaimer: The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

title: High School Mathematics Teacher
description:
**Mission and Background**

The Mary Louis Academy in Jamaica Estates, NY is a Catholic college preparatory school for young women sponsored by the Sisters of St. Joseph of Brentwood, NY, and rooted in their charism of unity, reconciliation and inclusive love that embraces all of creation. In an atmosphere that fosters academic excellence and respect, we seek to empower young women to realize and value their own unique gifts – spiritual, intellectual, social – and to use their gifts as leaders in creating a just society. We are a community that celebrates cultural diversity and continues the Catholic tradition of service.

As a single gender school, we are aware of our unique opportunity to help our students appreciate their womanhood and to develop their gifts in an atmosphere which fosters academic excellence and respect. As educators, we provide an environment shaped by Christian ideals that nurtures the whole person by integrating faith and life. We foster an awareness of an active engagement in ecological stewardship. We recognize that shared partnership with parents and guardians in developing young women who will take responsibility for their life choices and value service to their community. In a world increasingly impersonal, we endeavor to empower each student to realize and value her own unique spiritual, intellectual, physical, emotional and social potential as a leader in today’s society.

**Overview**

The ideal candidate will first and foremost be passionate about student growth as well as the teaching of upper-level mathematics in a high school setting and have a warm and engaging personality that can be used in developing meaningful relationships with each student. They will have mastery of educational pedagogy and a strong knowledge of mathematics, but will also be strongly motivated by continued opportunities to grow and develop as an effective educator. We are looking for an experienced teacher leader who is comfortable working with both students and colleagues and who is intentional about their educational approach.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Plan and teach a challenging course of study in a developmentally-appropriate manner, with an emphasis on differentiating instruction and the effective use of assessments.
* Model intellectual curiosity and maintain open-mindedness about different perspectives.
* Conduct classes with integrity, and model appropriate behavior for students.
* Actively engage students in learning by creating a student-centered classroom.
* Use positive reinforcement, manage discipline, and conflict resolution.
* Evaluate classwork and assessments regularly in a fair and equitable manner.
* Efficiently share evaluations, grades, and homework assignments with parents.
* Actively supervise students during supervisory/coverage duties and/or grade-level meetings, etc.
* Maintain current knowledge of curriculum and instructional methods, and pursue relevant opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Use technology in class preparation and/or instruction, while not relying solely on it.
* Share talents and work in partnership with team members on scheduling and planning.
* Actively participate in grade-level and faculty meetings.
* Be a positive and contributing member of the school community.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, computer science, education or other related subject required
* Master’s Degree in mathematics, computer science, education or other related subject preferred
* At least three (3) years of relevant, full-time high school mathematics or computer science teaching experience
* Past success teaching students with varying skill levels and learning styles
* Experience with thoughtful integration of technology into mathematics curricula
* Experience teaching to a range of learners
* Eagerness to contribute positively to the TMLA community
* Willingness to engage with and learn from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences
* Ability to bring joy, kindness, maturity, and flexibility to the school environment.

Please submit a cover letter and resume to .

title: Community Health Worker
description:
**Job Summary:**

Under the direction of the Program Administrator or Designee, the Community Health Worker is responsible for conducting community outreach activities and community collaboration to engage and refer community residents. Outreach staff will distribute information about MVNHC throughout the local neighborhoods, at events hosted by local municipal agencies, community-based organizations. Community Outreach workers will have extensive knowledge of community resources for vulnerable community residents.

**Primary Responsibility of the Position:**

* Develops and maintains professional relationships with community and community leaders, i.e., churches, community action programs, etc. to assist in gaining health center acceptance by the community
* Presents programs and/or educational forums about the health center’s goals and objectives
* Exhibits strong interpersonal, communication and problem-solving skills
* Performs home visits to ensure that all information regarding related health services is communicated to ensure positive health outcomes
* Informs residents and potential patients about the availability of MVNHC services.
* Interprets MVNHC services in conjunction with identifying current and potential patient’s needs for services.
* Establishes community to ensure that patients are aware of and have access to all suitable programs and services available at MVNHC.
* Performs related outreach tasks as assigned.
* Assists and streamlines the registration process of identified outreach individuals.
* Follow-up with registered MVNHC individuals regarding services rendered.
* Calls registered MVNHC individuals as a reminder for follow-up or referral appointments.
* Provides and collects “Satisfaction Survey” of services rendered.
* Participates in special community events providing information that promotes the services of MVNHC.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Education and Experience:**

* Graduation from a standard high school or general equivalent diploma
* One (1) year prior experience related to the duties and responsibilities specified, or five (5) years of professional experience providing outreach services in a health care setting or equivalent combination of education and experience that provided the required skills, knowledge, and abilities.
* Demonstrated reading and comprehension ability necessary to understand materials.
* Ability to serve as liaison to community organizations as assigned. Has acquired full understanding of ethical issues related to patients’ rights and HIPAA Laws.
* Must possess knowledge of community support services, basic requirements of community outreach duties, have acquired knowledge of the scope and activities of public and private health and community organizations.
* Must possess working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office (Windows, Word, Excel) email, internet research.
* Has the ability to communicate with patients, staff and associates effectively.
* Exhibits good judgement, tact, courtesy, integrity and is in physical condition commensurate with carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position.

title: Electrical Apprentice Instructor
description:
**New Jersey Independent Electrical Contractors**

**Position:**

IEC Apprenticeship Technical Instructor

**Primary Role:**

The IEC Apprenticeship technical instructor has primary responsibilities for delivering the IEC Apprenticeship training curriculum to students in the Apprenticeship program. The instructor provides technical support, supervision, oversight and direction to assist in the learning process of apprentices using a combination of training methods that motivate student learning.

**Specific Position requirements:**

The technical instructor uses multiple training techniques including presentation and lecture, “show and tell”, group presentations by students and other effective instructional methods in the New Jersey IEC Chapter’s Apprenticeship Training Program. Interaction with the online CMS curriculum portal will also be required.

* Uses the National IEC’s Curriculum to deliver provided PowerPoint presentations, visual aids, communication skills for customer interaction, and other pertinent options.
* Instruct students individually and in groups, using and approved curriculum and various teaching methods such as lecture, discussion, and demonstration.
* Follows the curriculum lesson plan for each course date to ensure all learning objectives are covered in each class.
* Possesses communication skills including a developed syllabus and the ability to speak to groups.
* Communicates effectively and helps students develop good study habits.
* Observe and evaluate students' work to determine progress and make suggestions for improvement.
* Prepare students for further education by encouraging them to explore learning opportunities and to persevere with challenging tasks.
* Maintain accurate and complete student records as required and internal policies.
* Attends instructor meetings as required.
* Completes other duties as required and asks for assistance when needed.

**Classroom Management:**

The technical instructor uses classroom management skills to develop a fair and consistent method of discipline in the classroom that helps students and the instructor maintain classroom order. This discipline helps students develop good study habits, ensures timely submission of assignments and reinforces good safety procedures. Furthermore this discipline maintains the safety and credibility of the IEC Apprenticeship program and instructor at all times.

**Essential Skills, Education and Experience:**

* A high school diploma or General Education Equivalent (GED).
* Actively performed work on electrical systems in the construction, repair or design as they pertain to the residential, commercial or industrial industry for a minimum of five (5) years.
* Extensive knowledge and understanding of the National Electrical Code.
* Good communication skills.
* Basic computer skills demonstrating effective use of Microsoft Office products and is comfortable accessing online course materials.
* Completion of a course of study in electrical construction under the direction and supervision of an established school or apprenticeship program is preferred
* Possess or willing to possess an IEC Teaching Certification.
* Include in resume your expertise as it relates to the electrical industry.
* Ability to complete objectives without direct supervision.
* Teaching experience preferred, but not required upon showing of adequate teaching skills.'

title: Certified Peer Advocate
description:
Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we’ve been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

The OASAS **Certified Recovery Peer Advocate** position requires someone who is culturally aware and sensitive to the needs of the Latino population, possesses excellent computer skills, can function as a part of an interdisciplinary team, and have an understanding of therapy and group work rooted in evidenced-based approaches for intervention and management strategies. Peer Support services are peer-delivered services with a rehabilitation and recovery focus. They are designed to promote skills for coping with and managing behavioral health symptoms while facilitating the utilization of natural resources and the enhancement of recovery-oriented principles (e.g. hope and self-efficacy, and community living skills). Peer support uses trauma-informed, non-clinical assistance to achieve long-term recovery from a behavioral health disorder. **This is a non-union position.**

**Pays: $21.97 per hour.** 

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Provide integrated peer care services to the client population at the clinic as indicated by the OASAS, CCBHC expansion scope of practice.
* Provide clients with services in the field as required.
* Participate in grant-related workshops and training.
* Use the grant portals; SPARS to enter any grant-required data in terms of service provision, and clinical indicators.
* Provide recovery-oriented interventions for adults and children diagnosed with severe and persistent mental illnesses and co-morbid disorders.
* Provide integrated dual disorder services, including relapse prevention planning.
* Conduct assessments and groups specific to substance abuse and dependency.
* Utilize motivational interviewing and other EBPs while working with individuals at different stages of change to help individuals reduce use/abstain from substance use.
* Work as a member of the multidisciplinary treatment team that practices client-centered and holistic care; accompany clients to appointments and complete warm-hand referrals, including health homes services.
* Communicate effectively with clients and collateral contacts and conduct outreach for care coordination.
* Provide advocacy services for clients, including assisting individuals to obtain benefits and entitlements, obtain food, obtain housing, and access appropriate care in the community.
* Conduct interim visits with individuals after a discharge from a hospital, rehab, or inpatient stay to facilitate community tenure and increased readiness while waiting for the first post-discharge visit with a community-based mental health provider.
* Assist in the selection and utilization of self-directed recovery tools such as relapse prevention planning.
* Connect individuals to self-help groups in the community.
* Provide recovery education and counseling to individuals and their family members.
* Provide transitional support- bridging from an institution (jail, hospital, rehab) to an individual"s home.
* Provide pre-crisis and crisis support services.
* Provide parent skills development and training.
* Conduct groups with families to strengthen social skills, decrease isolation, provide emotional support and create opportunities for ongoing natural support.
* Participate in staff and organizational meetings as requested for care coordination and development of policies and procedures.
* Maintain compliance with all organizational policies and procedures.
* Facilitate and co-facilitate EBPs groups.
* Participate as a member of the EBPs group's curriculum development process.
* Perform additional relevant duties as requested by supervisor/management.
* Complete office duties as needed/required.
* Complete wellness, and health promotion activities.

**EDUCATION AND REQUIREMENTS:**

* **High school diploma or equivalent required**
* **NYS Certified Recovery Peer Advocate Certification (CRPA or CRPA-P) required.**
* *Strongly preferred:* Bi-lingual (Spanish/English)
* Experience or desire to work with people who have a mental illness.
* Experience or desire to work with people with substance use disorders.
* Positive attitude and professional demeanor
* Ability to complete work independently as well as in collaboration with team members.
* Must be team oriented with a willingness to be flexible and helpful.
* Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Windows, Excel, PowerPoint, and electronic communications tools: internet and email.
* Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing.
* Highly organized, motivated self-starter
* Excellent time management skills

**\\*Acacia Network is an equal opportunity employer\\***

title: Infusion Pharmacy Technician
description:
**Position Summary:**

To ensure overall quality of medication and infusion preparation for agents administered in the Summit Health Infusion Center(s). Compound chemotherapeutic and non-chemotherapeutic agents in the Summit Health Infusion Center(s). Ensure compliance with USP-800 guidelines for the handling of hazardous drugs.

**Essential Job functions:**

The Infusion Pharmacy Technician will be expected to demonstrate ability to perform the following:

* Review prescriptions to assure accuracy, to ascertain the needed ingredients, and to evaluate their suitability.
* Compounds medications, chemotherapy and biotherapy using proper aseptic technique.
* Assess the identity, strength, or purity of medications.
* Properly handle and dispose of hazardous drugs and waste materials following OSHA and NIOSH guidelines.
* Perform mathematical calculations to determine appropriate drug measurements for compounding of ordered medications.
* Plan, implement, or maintain procedures for missing, packaging, or labeling pharmaceuticals, according to policy and legal requirements, to ensure quality, security, and proper disposal.
* Enter and remove medications into and from the Nucleus System.
* Conduct routine medication inventories including monitoring for drugs expiring, and assist with inventory control of medications in the infusion room, storage room and satellite locations.
* Assist in ordering supplies and medication. Receive and restock medications.
* Maintain any necessary QA logs, including (but not limited to) cleaning logs, temperature logs, waste logs, expired and destroyed medication logs, and others.
* Participate in training and orientation of new employees as needed.
* Comply with the Summit Health incident reporting policy and procedures.
* Adhere to all OSHA and Summit Health training and accomplishments as required per policy.
* Provide other job duties as assigned.
* Report issues and concerns to supervising pharmacist and manager in a timely manner.
* Follow the established Intellidose Workflow

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* High School Graduate/GED/ Equivalent Work
* Vocational / Technical School / Diploma Program
* New York Board of Pharmacy Technician registration
* Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) with PTCB
* Minimum 2 years of hospital experience, including IV compounding
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing
* Standard Office Equipment (Phone, Fax, Copy Machine, Scanner, Email/Voice Mail)
* Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment
* Valid License

*Pay Range $25/hr to $32/hr*

*The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position*

description:
**Assistant Manager**

Are you tenacious, driven retail manager? Are you friendly and outgoing? Are you ambitious – the take charge type who makes things happen? If so, keep reading.

A rapidly growing **car wash** chain based in Central New Jersey is seeking an **Assistant Manager** to drive growth and profitability at the site. We are seeking an **Assistant Manager** who can successfully manage, lead and direct the efforts of a team, while maintaining a high degree of engagement and morale.

If you are looking for a workplace where your voice is heard, your ideas are encouraged, and you can make an immediate impact, then we want to talk with you!

**The ideal candidate:**

* Proactively manages the day to day operations of the car wash
* Works directly with Executive Leadership Team to make strategic recommendations on process improvements
* Trains and develops team members, leading them to their fullest potential
* Sets a positive example, inspecting and promoting teamwork
* Consistently demonstrates the ability to motivate and encourage team members

**Requirements:**

* Results-oriented with the ability to push self and others towards success
* Friendly, energetic attitude with a passion for helping people
* Strong personal commitment to successfully managing and leading growth
* Superior leadership and organizational skills
* Complete all physical requirements of the job with or without a reasonable accommodation
* Must be able to stand for the majority of the shift
* Be able to carry and move boxes 50 pounds or more across the site
* Constantly working in outdoor weather conditions

High earnings potential through competitive base pay and compensation structure that rewards performance through a structured bonus program

The **Assistant Manager** is the driver of our company’s growth. This individual will lead the charge of our company core values and strengthen the team around them. If you have a competitive mindset and are looking for a challenge, then the **Assistant Manager** role is for you!

***Click to apply!***
