title: Investment Banking - Real Estate - Analyst
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Investment Banking Analyst to join our dynamic Real Estate team, offering an exceptional opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions and drive growth within a leading financial institution.

**Job Summary**


As an Analyst in the Investment Banking Division, you will be a key player in the execution of the firm's business. You will work with expert professionals at the heart of a leading global investment bank. Senior bankers will get to know you - both as a person and as a valued member of a winning team. You will experience training, hands-on learning opportunities, continuous mentoring and feedback, and numerous development opportunities. You will use your related experience to contribute to the firm's M&A execution and capital raising capabilities while helping build J.P. Morgan's franchise and reputation in the marketplace. You will develop strong functional skills in the major areas of investment banking and become a senior client executive who is capable of generating and executing your own transactions. Joining here means you’ll become part of our inclusive teams and culture, unified by the firm’s mission and commitment to success.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Execute transactions: support due diligence, document preparation, negotiation etc and liaising with relevant counterpart at the client/other advisers (accounting, legal, etc)
* Working with J.P. Morgan product and sector teams
* Building and using complex financial models, completing valuation and analytical exercises
* Drafting presentation materials, management presentations, board materials, memorandums, and other presentation materials for use in M&A and capital markets transactions or strategic client dialogue
* Keeping abreast of key market developments and establishing knowledge of the target client base and relevant market dynamics

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Prior work experience in an investment banking front office, or related, role.
* Strong accounting, finance, quantitative and business writing skills.
* A well-rounded academic background from a top tier educational institution.
* Understanding of the transaction cycle and the steps in the process and is execution oriented.
* Impeccable communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with senior professionals, clients and key stakeholders in other line of business.
* Self-directed, highly motivated, and able to work independently.

title: Firmwide Economic Scenarios Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

Join the Firmwide Economic Scenarios & Analytics team within the Office of the Chief Financial Officer, where you'll oversee the development and distribution of macroeconomic scenarios used in the Firm's forecasting processes. You'll collaborate with various teams and corporate areas, covering key U.S. and global macroeconomic indicators. As an Associate, you'll play an integral role in scenario design and macroeconomic forecasting, with exposure to senior leaders and the opportunity to develop crucial leadership and analytical skills.


As a Firmwide Economic Scenarios Associate within the Office of the Chief Financial Officer, you will play an integral role in the team’s scenario design work and macroeconomic forecasting. You will have the opportunity to directly execute forecasts for macroeconomic variables and interact with senior leaders, developing important leadership and analytical skills required to advance in the Firm.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Support the execution of macroeconomic forecasts that make up the scenarios, working closely with key forecasting partners (JPM Economics / Strategy research teams or other experts) and consumers of the scenarios (Risk and Finance Lines of Business)
* Monitor and prepare commentary on economic releases and events, monitor evolving risks, stay abreast of trends in economics and financial markets, and anticipate implications for macroeconomic forecasting and scenario design
* Manage multiple project workstreams as well as inbound questions, deliverables, and ad-hoc requests, with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness of meeting deliverables on prescribed timelines
* Develop executive-level presentations for senior management, regulators, and internal stakeholders
* Interact with and guide quantitative model development teams for the development and enhancement of macroeconomic forecasting methodologies
* Lead ad-hoc analysis and conduct economic research as needed

**Required Qualifications, Skills, and Capabilities:**


* Strong quantitative skills: Master’s or Bachelor's degree preferably in Economics, Econometrics, Quantitative Finance, or related field
* 3+ years of work experience in research / forecasting / business analytics for a leading financial institution / central bank / consulting firm or similar, with a strong background / interest in economics
* Exceptionally detail-oriented with the ability to synthesize large amounts of data and various viewpoints, summarize key concepts, and clearly articulate relevant conclusions
* Excellent organizational and communication (verbal and written) skills
* A proven track record of executing against deliverables and meeting deadlines under pressure
* Self-starter, with an ability to multitask in a fast-paced, environment with frequently changing priorities
* Works well individually and in teams, shares information, supports colleagues, and encourages participation

**Preferred Qualifications, Skills, and Capabilities:**


* Experience with scenario design in the context of CCAR, and / or CECL is a plus
* Experience in forecasting, statistical analysis or research on macroeconomic and / or financial variables would be considered a plus
* Experience with programming languages / statistical software (e.g., EViews, Python, R, Excel VBA) is a plus and advanced Excel and Microsoft Office skills are required
* Experience working with structural and semi-structural macroeconomic forecasting models (e.g., DSGE, FRB/US, NiGEM) is considered a plus
* PhD is considered a plus

title: Markets Legal Entity Treasury Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

CIB Treasury is looking to hire a person to help manage the legal entity treasury function in North America. The candidate will be responsible for a variety of tasks including:


* Funding and liquidity analysis, optimization and forecasting for CIB Markets entities in North America, primarily JP Morgan Securities LLC, the US Broker-Dealer;
* working with LOB financing desks on funding strategy;
* coordinating with Corporate Treasury and Liquidity Risk Oversight on short- and long-term planning for firmwide funding and liquidity;
* provide NBIA feedback on CIBT behalf to new CIB Markets initiatives


* coordinate intraday funding for capital markets activity;
* interface with regulators and other external stakeholders on balance sheet and liquidity topics.

The candidate will be part of a 5-person team and participate in regular meetings with Corporate Treasury, Liquidity Risk Management, front office LOBs, and the broader CIB Treasury team along with frequent exposure to other CIB F&BM functions.

**Qualifications**


The candidate must be a self-starter who is able to work in a fast paced, results driven environment, be confident and have excellent written and verbal communication skills, as this role will have global exposure and responsibility across varying levels of management.

* Working knowledge of Investment Bank products along with financial theory and accounting principles preferred; inclusive of secured funding and financing instruments (repo/reverse repo, securities borrows, synthetics etc.)
* Knowledge or awareness of funding & liquidity management principles and regulatory developments in the treasury space
* Strong project management skills; ability to gain consensus and drive initiatives to completion effectively
* A ‘hands on’ team player who is equally comfortable carrying out detailed analysis on an independent basis or coordinating input from others
* Strong business judgment and autonomy
* Ability to multi-task, work well under pressure with commitment to deliver under tight deadlines
* Strong critical thinking, process and control mindset. In addition, strong attention to detail
* Excellent working knowledge of Excel ,PowerPoint (including PitchPro), Tableau. Knowledge of Python, Alteryx, and VBA is a definite plus.
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills and a strong track record of partnership with internal/external stakeholders




**ABOUT US**  


JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.


We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.


JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  


The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.  

  

Global Finance & Business Management works to strategically manage capital, drive growth and efficiencies, maintain financial reporting and proactively manage risk. By providing information, analysis and recommendations to improve results and drive decisions, teams ensure the company can navigate all types of market conditions while protecting our fortress balance sheet.

title: Funeral Assistant / Transport
description:
**About us**

Bitecola Funeral Service Group is a small business in Bloomfield, NJ. We are professional, inclusive, and challenging. We provide funeral services to local institutions and other funeral homes.

Our work environment includes:

* Flexible working hours
* On-the-job training
* Safe work environment
* Friendly working environment

Experience in funeral service, transportation, and healthcare preferred. Training will be provided. If no experience in the mentioned fields, please describe why you would be a good fit on application.

Full Job Description:

The current job requirement is 3 flexible week days, with 2 overnights and every other weekend on call, with the opportunity for additional shifts as needed.

The ideal candidate will prepare and transport a decedent from a place of death (i.e. residence, nursing homes, hospital) to a facility (i.e. funeral home, or medical examiner). In addition, provide assistance at visitations / funerals and drive livery vehicles.

Each employee is required to be available to receive calls given to him/her during the on-call period. Each employee is required to answer calls promptly and have immediate access to dress clothes and be able to depart from the funeral home within 20 minutes or less of receiving the call.

Requirements:

A clean driving record and a valid NJ driver's license.

A vehicle to get to and from our location, or meeting spot

TEAM HEAVY LIFTING. Our staff is required to be able to lift and carry (with a partner) weights in excess of 300 pounds, sometimes down flights of stairs.

Professional Dress. Our staff is required to dress professionally and conservatively. Our staff is required to be clean, neat, and well-groomed at all times. Men are required to wear: black dress slacks with belt, black dress socks, and dress shoes, long sleeve dress shirt, and tie. Women are required to wear: Black dress slacks, black dress socks and dress shoes (no heel), long sleeve dress shirts.

100% professionalism at all times

Compassion towards Families

Respect and Gentleness when handling a decedent

Clean Driving record/to be approved by our Insurance Company

Able to perform the assigned tasks without direct supervision

Clean and neat work habits

Good organizational skills

Able to perform under stressful situations

We are a Drug-Free Workplace and each post-hire employee will be subject to a drug test, as well as randomly thereafter.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: Per case, and agreed upon rate when not in office

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Night shift
* On call
* Overnight shift
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* What makes me you good fit for this position?
* Do you have experience in the funeral industry? If so what experience do you have?
* Are you available to work alternating weekends?
* Do you have a vehicle, or access to one, to transport yourself to and from our location or meeting spot?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Shift availability:

* Overnight Shift (Required)
* Day Shift (Required)
* Night Shift (Required)

title: MEDIA COORDINATOR
description:
Poste


Louis Vuitton Americas is seeking a creative Media Coordinator to orchestrate our media narrative across the Americas region. This role is a cornerstone in harmonizing our online and offline presence, ensuring that each campaign not only meets but exceeds the expectations set by our legacy.

  


Profil


Key Responsibilities:


* Lead comprehensive planning for both digital and traditional media campaigns including digital display, print media, Out-of-Home (OOH), and lightbox initiatives.
* Implement campaigns with precision in partnership with the Media Manager and collaborate closely with local agencies to ensure coordinated strategies across all channels.
* Lead financial accuracy by meticulously overseeing budgets against cross-platform media plans.
* Contribute to strategy development alongside the Media Manager for efficient channel mix to achieve campaign goals.
* Directly engage with Louis Vuitton Headquarters for campaign creative direction—from lightbox concepts to digital display content creation.
* Coordinate an intricate calendar for lightbox allocation, production schedules, and updates.
* Analyze e-commerce metrics in concert with merchandise trends to optimize campaign performance.
* Develop strong relationships with internal teams such as Merchandising, Communications, Store Planning as well as external partners including agencies and shopping center media groups.

Qualifications:


* Proven experience in print or digital media within a high-profile brand or agency environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook) is needed for communicating effectively and leading sophisticated timelines.
* Independently drive projects forward while also being highly organized to meet overlapping deadlines in a fast-paced setting.
* A diligent approach ensuring all creative aspects—layout, color palette, copy—are perfectly aligned with Louis Vuitton’s global standards before going into production.


What You Will Bring:


You are someone who embodies passion for both luxury fashion and impactful storytelling through various media. Your ability to navigate between meticulous analysis and bold creativity makes you ideal for this role. With your strong work ethic combined with problem-solving skills; your collaborative nature complements your sense of accountability. Your voice will contribute significantly towards our legacy as you shape how Louis Vuitton Americas resonates across continents.


We invite those who have carved out their expertise in the dynamic field of media planning within luxury sectors or esteemed agencies to join us on this journey. If you’re ready to play a pivotal part in our storied maison’s ongoing saga of innovation married with heritage—apply now.

title: LSW/LAC Clinician (Full-time, Hybrid, Flexible)
description:
Are you a recent grad looking for a unique opportunity that’s not your typical 9-5? If you're seeking flexibility, hands-on experience, and the chance to work both remotely and within your community, this could be the perfect fit for you!

At Savia Community Counseling Services, LLC, we're on a mission to create positive change in the lives of those we serve. Our strength-based approach to mental health services is designed to empower both our youth and families and our team members.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Flexibility:** Enjoy a full-time position with a mix of telehealth and in-person sessions, plus time for documentation and collateral calls.
* **Clinical Supervision:** Gain valuable supervision hours toward your license while learning from experienced professionals.
* **Impactful Work:** Make a real difference by providing therapeutic counseling to children and families.
* **Professional Growth:** Develop your skills in a supportive environment that’s dedicated to your career advancement.

**Responsibilities:**

* Dedicate 26 hours per week to face-to-face sessions (telehealth/in-person) with children and families.
* Allocate 14 hours per week for documentation, collateral calls, and other administrative tasks.
* Teach strategies to manage challenging behaviors, helping to build healthier family dynamics.
* Collaborate with Child-Family Teams (CFT) including behavioral assistants, mentors, care managers, and other community resources.
* Participate in supervision sessions to discuss and refine your therapeutic approach.
* Develop and implement personalized treatment plans.
* Maintain thorough documentation of your work, including progress notes and treatment plans.

\\*

**Requirements:**

* Valid New Jersey License (LSW, LAC, LMFT, LCSW, LPC).
* At least 1 year of experience working with children in the mental health field.
* Valid NJ Driver’s License.

**Benefits:**

* Clinical supervision hours.
* Medical, vision, and dental insurance.
* Short-term disability coverage.
* Paid time off
* Paid training days and holidays.
* Opportunities for professional development and career growth.

Join Savia Community Counseling Services, LLC, and start making a difference today!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Life insurance

* LSW or LAC (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Director, Private Equity
description:
* The ideal candidate will have significant leadership experience working closely with influential and high-profile executives, preferably in the private equity (PE) industry.
* He/She will have experience interacting at the CXO/VP level, with a good understanding of Cloud or related technology. He/She will think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions and work cross-organizationally to build consensus.
* Have a keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness are critical.
* The right person will be technical and analytical, and possess at least 10-15 years of executive leadership experience in sales.
* Have existing CXO relationships, with a large network in more than one industry.
* Strong leadership skills are key, with superior verbal and written communications skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
* Relevant technical knowledge is helpful, including in areas such as: database systems, IoT, core distributed computing concepts, fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, etc.
* The ability to go deep on relevant trends in the PE industry and understand the world of this customer segment.
* A Bachelor’s Degree is required.


Do you want to lead a global team focused on building relationships with the top private equity (PE) firms in the world? Do you have the strategic thinking, relationship building skills, technical depth, and executive level communication skills needed to help further establish AWS as the leader within the PE industry? The PE industry is looking for new ways to create value for their portfolio companies. Technical and digital transformation, increased agility, retirement of technical debt and assistance migrating their companies to the cloud are all increasingly becoming an important level for them to utilize. AWS is looking for a Director, Private Equity, who understands business trends impacting the PE industry and who is passionate and capable of driving market development globally for AWS, leveraging the richness of the AWS cloud computing platform to position and drive the right technology solutions to the portfolio companies of the PE firms, and also to create programs for the PE firms themselves.
  
Your responsibilities will include managing a cross-functional team focused on building relationships with PE firms so as to develop access to their portfolio companies, and who can provide influence over their portfolio companies. Your leadership will be global in scope and you will be responsible for the development of all strategies and programs for this function. As part of this leadership position, you and your team will be engaging with high profile PE executives who exhibit a material amount of influence in the IT industry and over their portfolio. You will be expected to attend and speak at a number of PE related events, including CxO meetings and conferences. You will also work closely with AWS Field Seller, Private Pricing, Partner and Solutions Architects teams to develop and promote cloud and GenAI solutions, as well as migration opportunities for the PE portfolio companies. As Director, Private Equity you will be a part of the sales organization, driving revenue by building relationships with Partners of Private Equity companies, to advance AWS adoption within portfolio companies.
  
  

Roles and Responsibilities
  
* Scale out an integrated go-to-market team in a highly complex environment
* Develop and execute against a set of goals including customer references, support, professional services, and training
* Develop and deliver compelling ROI to drive adoption of AWS Gen AI solutions by collaborating cross-functionally to continuously strengthen AWS's GenAI value proposition
* Develop relationships and engage with cross-functional and partner ecosystems to extend reach and drive adoption
* Build and leverage relationships with internal and external stakeholders to further adoption of AWS services in the market
* Support all AWS operating cadences and represent a consolidated view of the Private Equity customer segment to senior AWS leaders
* Guide a Customer Obsessed business that delights our customers
* Expect 50%+ travel to visit customers and travel


Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: First and foremost, this leader will be an independent thinker who can make convincing, information-based arguments. With a strong bias for action, this individual will have an ability to work equally well with operations teams, executive management and external stakeholders.
  
  

* Exhibits excellent judgment
* Hires great people. Develops great people.
* High standard for customer obsession
* Has relentlessly high standards
* Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution
* Expects and requires innovation of her/his team
* Thinks big and has convictions
* Results oriented
* Has the innate ability to inspire passion in others
* Degree in Computer Science and MBA or other relevant advanced degree.


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $232,400/year in our lowest geographic market up to $345,800/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
AthenaPsych is a New York State mental health approved provider of community mental health services for children, adults, and families with behavioral and emotional challenges. We specialize in individual and group psychotherapy for clients with a focus on trauma-informed care. We are dedicated to improving the quality and accessibility of mental health care for all, especially individuals from underserved communities.

We are seeking a compassionate and organized Front Desk Receptionist to join our outpatient mental health clinic. The ideal candidate will provide excellent front desk support, ensuring a welcoming environment for clients and their families. Responsibilities include managing client appointments, greeting all clients with a professional demeanor and assisting with administrative tasks while maintaining confidentiality and sensitivity to client needs.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Professionally greet clients entering the clinic while managing the check-in/check-out process.
* Manage all client foot traffic and direct inquiries to appropriate staff.
* Schedule follow up client appointments and maintain the clinic’s internal calendar.
* Handle basic administrative tasks, including filing, making copies and data entry
* Manage incoming and outgoing mail correspondences, incoming faxes, shipments, and additional recordkeeping tasks.
* Respond to all client inquiries in a polite and timely manner.
* Ensure the reception area is tidy and presentable, stocked with all necessary stationery and material (e.g. pens, forms and brochures).
* Interact with clinical and administrative staff onsite to assist with any clerical duties or requests.

**Qualifications**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* **Bilingual in Spanish Required.**
* Experience in a healthcare setting preferred.

title: Clinical, Part-Time
description:
Clinical, Part-time responsibilities include the supervision and evaluation of clinical lab and/or patient care experiences as assigned by Program Director.
  

**Characteristics, Duties, and Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with FT and PT faculty members to implement desired clinical instruction.
* Demonstrate required psychomotor skills for students.
* Prepare and post patient care assignments.
* Supervise students’ skill practice and clinical patient care.
* Communicate with personnel on clinical units, including pre- and post-care conferences.
* Correct inaccurate or unsafe skill performance by students.
* Evaluate critical skill performance.
* Maintain a safe practice environment.
* Report on student performance to full-time and Part-time faculty members or coordinator.
* Demonstrate professional accountability by being punctual for class and obtaining coverage if necessary for absences.
* Utilize principles of current nursing practice for clinical experiences.
* Adhere to professional standards and legal guidelines of practice.
* Attend scheduled departmental staff meetings.


  

**Education Requirements**
* Master’s degree in nursing and current N.J. RN nursing license.


  

**Experience**
* Minimum of 3 years clinical nursing experience required.
* Teaching experience is preferred.


  

**Competencies and Skills Required**
* Demonstrated mastery of subject matter or discipline


o Clinical and/or instructional experience in the specific nursing field (ex. Pediatrics)  

o Demonstration of clinical nursing techniques
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* This position’s duties are normally performed in a typical interior/residence work environment, based on the activity scheduled.

  

* Some physical effort required; however, the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

  

* No or very limited exposure to physical risk.

  

* Some travel required.

  

* Ability to stand and walk for extended period of time in clinical patient care setting.

  

**Salary** $65.00 per hour
  

**Additional Information**Union County College does not discriminate and prohibits discrimination, as required by state and/or federal law, in all programs and activities, including employment and access to its career and technical programs.  

  

Union County College is an EEO/AAP Employer/Protected Veteran/Disabled  

================  

Disclaimer: This job description outlines the general nature and key features performed by various positions that share the same job classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of all employees assigned to the job. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or re-assign duties to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodations or other business reasons.
  

**Terms of Employment**
Flexible schedule to meet department needs. Some evening, weekends, and extended hours will be required. Ability and willingness to travel on short notice to all on and off- campus sites as needed by the college. Employee must establish primary residency in New Jersey within one year of appointment unless an exemption applies. Part-time hours not to exceed 25 per week.  

  

Travel to the campus and health care agencies, and hours outside of the traditional weekday work schedule may be required, including evenings and weekends.

title: DIGITAL MERCHANDISING MANAGER
description:
Poste


Louis Vuitton Americas is seeking a Digital Merchandising Manager to enhance online presence and amplify e-commerce growth throughout North and Latin America. You will craft captivating digital narratives and optimize our product offerings to elevate the Louis Vuitton experience online, driving sales across diverse categories. Working alongside our VP of Digital you will be instrumental in leading the overall digital e-commerce strategy.

  


Missions


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Forge synergies between Digital and Category Merchandising teams to define sales objectives and tactical approaches.
* Spearhead product launches within the LVA zone, ensuring seamless coordination of stock allocation, marketing tools, and initial sales analytics.
* Conceive a strategic vision for LV.com's visual merchandising in collaboration with Category Merchandising teams.
* Deliver incisive analyses of product traction and overall website commerce metrics.
* Proactively participate in Paris HQ buying sessions to curate distinctive seasonal assortments for LVA Digital, including exclusive offers, pre-orders, and early release items.
* In alliance with Merchandising, Digital Marketing, Data & Insights, and Supply Chain departments, champion Differentiated Selling by tracking sales against inventory levels—highlighting replenishment opportunities or proposing adjustments.


**Optimization of Product Assortment:**


* Serve as the principal liaison for all zonal merchandising & supply chain engagement.
* Uncover potential sales volume boosts by category; recommend enhancements to the product assortment.
* Work closely with Supply Chain to maintain optimal stock levels for mainstay products, peak seasons, and specific client demands.


**Insightful Performance Analysis:**


* Execute regular business reporting (weekly/monthly/on-demand) to shed light on performance strengths or gaps; provide strategic counsel for digital initiatives' enhancement.
* Evaluate website analytics rigorously; propose action plans geared towards user experience improvements.


**Strategic Localized Digital Direction & Implementation:**


* Interface with the Central e-Merch team to ensure localized execution aligns with overarching global strategies while securing flawless delivery of product assets.
* Oversee local online launch strategies in concert with e-Merch teams; guarantee timely optimization of all new releases.
* Maintain responsibility for everyday web updates through Content Management Systems across multiple regions (3 countries/4 locales/3 languages).


**Cultivating Team Collaborations:**


* Lead campaign development during key commercial periods such as holidays or major launches.
* Connect with Digital Performance team crafting sales projections & monitoring UX/e-Merchandise analytics closely.
* Synchronize efforts with Digital Marketing on product-centric campaigns across email marketing, social media platforms, and paid search avenues.
* Coordinate web content strategy including homepage features and dynamic presentations alongside the Digital Production team.
* Represent digital merchandising interests when working with Client Services regarding product inquiries or issues.


**Team Leadership & Development:**


* Guide your direct reports' professional growth within an environment that values continuous learning and industry-leading practices' adoption.
  


Profil


Ideal candidates will possess a track record and experience in Digital Merchandising or Marketing and e-commerce specific to retail or luxury brands. Up-to-date knowledge of digital merchandising and storytelling. Outstanding communication prowess is essential, coupled with proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Data Analytics, and Online Content Management Systems. We value creative minds with an entrepreneurial spirit capable of weaving compelling transversal narratives. You should be agile enough to juggle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


The appointed candidate will be offered a salary within the range of USD $120,000-130,000 annually plus the opportunity for a bonus, a comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, various paid time off programs, employee discount/perks and two retirement plans both with employer contributions.

  


Informations complémentaires


The position requires 4 days per week on site in the Louis Vuitton Corporate Office, located in the heart of Midtown, Manhattan.

title: Abercrombie & Fitch - Assistant Manager, Menlo Park
description:
**Company Description**  

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (NYSE: ANF) is a leading, global specialty retailer of apparel and accessories for men, women and kids through five renowned brands. The iconic Abercrombie & Fitch brand was born in 1892 and aims to make every day feel as exceptional as the start of a long weekend. abercrombie kids sees the world through kids’ eyes, where play is life and every day is an opportunity to be anything and better anything. The Hollister brand believes in liberating the spirit of an endless summer inside everyone and making teens feel celebrated and comfortable in their own skin. Gilly Hicks, offering intimates, loungewear and sleepwear, is designed to invite everyone to embrace who they are underneath it all. Social Tourist, the creative vision of Hollister and social media personalities, Dixie and Charli D’Amelio, offers trend forward apparel that allows teens to experiment with their style, while exploring the duality of who they are both on social media and in real life.


The brands share a commitment to offering products of enduring quality and exceptional comfort that allow consumers around the world to express their own individuality and style. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. operates approximately 730 stores under these brands across North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East, as well as the e-commerce sites www.abercrombie.com, www.abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com, www.gillyhicks.com, and www.socialtourist.com.

 **Job Description**  

The Assistant Manager is a multi-faceted role that merges business strategy, operations, creativity, and people management. Strategically, assistant managers are responsible for driving sales results by analyzing the business and providing best-in-class customer service. They are responsible for overseeing daily store operations including opening and closing routines and driving efficiency in all store processes. Assistant managers leverage their creative expertise through floorset updates, styling recommendations and product knowledge. Assistant managers are also talent leaders, driving everything from recruiting and training to engagement and development. They are expected to show up, bringing their best selves everyday to create an inclusive place of belonging for their team and customers. With a promote from within philosophy, our Assistant managers will build upon their initial foundation and have the opportunity to grow into the future leaders of our store’s organization.

  

**What You’ll Do**

* Customer Experience
* Drives Sales
* OMNI Channel Fulfillment
* Store Presentation and Sales Floor Supervision
* Store & Stockroom Operations
* Staffing, Scheduling, and Payroll Management
* Training and Development
* Communication
* Asset Protection

  

**Qualifications** **What it Takes**

* Bachelor’s degree OR one year of supervisory experience in a customer-facing role
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Inclusion & Diversity Awareness
* Ability to show up in a fast-paced and challenging environment
* Team building skills
* Self-starter
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Drive to achieve results
* Adaptability / Flexibility
* Multi-Tasking
* Fashion Interest & Knowledge

  

**Additional Information** **What You’ll Get**


As an Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward:

* Quarterly Incentive Bonus Program
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Volunteer Day per Year, allowing you to give back to your community
* Merchandise Discount
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available
* Life and Disability Insurance
* Associate Assistance Program
* Paid Parental and Adoption Leave
* 401(K) Savings Plan with Company Match
* Training and Development
* Opportunities for Career Advancement, we believe in promoting from within
* A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU

  

SEE WHAT IT’S LIKE TO #WORKATANF - FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM @LIFEATANF


Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer

title: HR MANAGER, COMPENSATION & HR ANALYTICS
description:
Poste


Louis Vuitton Americas is seeking a Manager of Compensation & HR Analytics. This is a pivotal role that combines strategic financial acumen with human resource expertise. Reporting to the Director of Compensation & Benefits, you will be instrumental in shaping compensation strategies alongside our retail & corporate teams and be deeply involved in financial processes alongside our HR Analytics Manager.


Key Responsibilities:  

**Compensation:**
* Develop and validate competitive compensation proposals specifically for Retail Management positions.
* Ensure adherence to wage and hour regulations and recommend necessary adjustments.
* Engage in two luxury retail market salary surveys annually, plus additional corporate sector surveys.
* Analyze market trends and salaries, presenting findings on both an annual basis and as situations dictate.
* Annually reassess tools used for non-managerial roles in retail and corporate settings.
* Assist the C&B Director with overseeing the Zone’s comprehensive compensation review process, particularly focusing on non-manager roles.
  


Profil


**Reporting:**
* Maintain accurate monthly headcount records across different zones ensuring data integrity.
* Generate required HR reports serving business needs while working towards streamlining reporting processes through automation where possible.
* Oversee mandatory annual reporting tasks such as Social Report preparation, risk management assessments, and semiannual LVMH Reports.


**Agility:**
* Act as the central figure managing our Human Resources Database (HRDB), suggesting improvements, resolving issues, and delivering training to HR personnel.


**Innovation:**
* Design advanced compensation tools aiding Regional HRDs/Store leaders in making educated compensation decisions.

  

The ideal candidate will bring sophisticated expertise in Compensation & HR Analytics crafting nuanced compensation frameworks along with financial analysis. Experience with global mobilities and a passion for growth within HR is vital. Key qualifications include a strong understanding of HR data and systems (Korn Ferry, Mercer, UltiPro) coupled with budgeting expertise. Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint; prior experience with an HRIS is advantageous. Exceptional organizational skills complemented by superior communication abilities. Demonstrated analytical prowess with a track record of actionable recommendations Independent work ethic matched by a capacity to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines. Keen sensitivity toward confidential matters coupled with diplomatic problem-solving skills. A proactive attitude towards embracing change positively. A creative mindset driven by innovation especially regarding technological solutions/ Customer-focused professionalism able to respond efficiently to inquiries. Ability to forge robust relationships across all levels within the organization. French Language proficiency is a plus.  

  

Informations complémentaires


The appointed candidate will be offered a salary within the range of USD $110,000-125,000 annually plus the opportunity for a bonus, a comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, various paid time off programs, employee discount/perks and two retirement plans both with employer contributions.  

The position requires 4 days per week on site in the Louis Vuitton Corporate Office, located in the heart of Midtown, Manhattan.

title: DISTRIBUTION PLANNING MANAGER- SHOES & RTW
description:
Poste


Louis Vuitton is seeking a Distribution Planning Manager to join our Supply Chain team. This team member will be responsible for owning inventory to support the sales in their network of stores they will have a focus on Shoes & Ready to Wear.


The Distribution Planning Manager will use their analytical skills and market knowledge to supervise distribution, proactively chip in to meeting sales targets, and ensure appropriate availability rate with optimal stock level. More specifically, this position will lead all aspects of their specific store network, RTW Optimization, support of the showroom, and store forecast optimization. The optimal candidate will possess strong knowledge of Python and analytical skills.


This role will:
* Supply to sales budget construction via the store operations
* Define and communicate the target stock level and model stock for each Store / Market / Subsidiary according to life cycle and encouraged service level
* Ensure the inventory deployment based on demand and inventory level in coordination with the demand manager
* Find opportunities of product rebalancing in distribution network
* Plan and coordinate new product launches and end of life product strategies in agreement with the Retail and Merchandising departments
  


Profil


As a Distribution Planning Manager you will complete action plans to improve processes, methods and tools as well as ensure coordination with Merchandising, Retail, Finance, & Logistics. You will allocate products according to priorities, opportunities, and constraints in terms of transportation, and shipping. Control product availability, identify and report the shortages/ stocks excess risks and communicate inventory to stores and merchandising teams.


We are eager to speak to professionals who are team spirited, great communicators and client centric. The ideal candidate for this role has expertise in inventory planning and analysis, as well as supply chain and merchandising allocation. Expert in understanding and experience coding in Python working with Power Bi, Tableau and Excel. Fluent in English, French and Spanish is a plus.


The appointed candidate will be offered a salary within the range of USD $115,000 - $120,000 annually plus the opportunity for a bonus, a comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, various paid time off programs, employee discount/perks and two retirement plans both with employer contributions.


The position requires 4 days per week on site in the Louis Vuitton Corporate Office, located in the heart of Midtown, Manhattan.

title: Hollister Co. - Assistant Manager, Hamilton
description:
**Company Description**  

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (NYSE: ANF) is a leading, global specialty retailer of apparel and accessories for men, women and kids through five renowned brands. The iconic Abercrombie & Fitch brand was born in 1892 and aims to make every day feel as exceptional as the start of a long weekend. abercrombie kids sees the world through kids’ eyes, where play is life and every day is an opportunity to be anything and better anything. The Hollister brand believes in liberating the spirit of an endless summer inside everyone and making teens feel celebrated and comfortable in their own skin. Gilly Hicks, offering intimates, loungewear and sleepwear, is designed to invite everyone to embrace who they are underneath it all. Social Tourist, the creative vision of Hollister and social media personalities, Dixie and Charli D’Amelio, offers trend forward apparel that allows teens to experiment with their style, while exploring the duality of who they are both on social media and in real life.


The brands share a commitment to offering products of enduring quality and exceptional comfort that allow consumers around the world to express their own individuality and style. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. operates approximately 730 stores under these brands across North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East, as well as the e-commerce sites www.abercrombie.com, www.abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com, www.gillyhicks.com, and www.socialtourist.com.

 **Job Description**  

The Assistant Manager is a multi-faceted role that merges business strategy, operations, creativity, and people management. Strategically, assistant managers are responsible for driving sales results by analyzing the business and providing best-in-class customer service. They are responsible for overseeing daily store operations including opening and closing routines and driving efficiency in all store processes. Assistant managers leverage their creative expertise through floorset updates, styling recommendations and product knowledge. Assistant managers are also talent leaders, driving everything from recruiting and training to engagement and development. They are expected to show up, bringing their best selves everyday to create an inclusive place of belonging for their team and customers. With a promote from within philosophy, our Assistant managers will build upon their initial foundation and have the opportunity to grow into the future leaders of our store’s organization.

  

**What You’ll Do**

* Customer Experience
* Drives Sales
* OMNI Channel Fulfillment
* Store Presentation and Sales Floor Supervision
* Store & Stockroom Operations
* Staffing, Scheduling, and Payroll Management
* Training and Development
* Communication
* Asset Protection

  

**Qualifications** **What it Takes**

* Bachelor’s degree OR one year of supervisory experience in a customer-facing role
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Inclusion & Diversity Awareness
* Ability to show up in a fast-paced and challenging environment
* Team building skills
* Self-starter
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Drive to achieve results
* Adaptability / Flexibility
* Multi-Tasking
* Fashion Interest & Knowledge

  

**Additional Information** **What You’ll Get**


As an Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward:

* Quarterly Incentive Bonus Program
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Volunteer Day per Year, allowing you to give back to your community
* Merchandise Discount
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available
* Life and Disability Insurance
* Associate Assistance Program
* Paid Parental and Adoption Leave
* 401(K) Savings Plan with Company Match
* Training and Development
* Opportunities for Career Advancement, we believe in promoting from within
* A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU

 **Job Description**  

A Key Holder (Part Time) provides great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer’s needs. Possesses an individualized style that relates to customers. Engages customers in a genuine way to drive sales and provide an exciting, fast and easy store experience. The Key Holder (Part Time) is also responsible for operating as the floor supervisor on duty in the absence of a manager in the store.


As a floor supervisor on duty, the Key Holder (Part Time) will be responsible for, but not limited to, completing basic store operations, opening and closing tasks and leading associates in daily tasks.

**What You’ll Do**

* Product Knowledge & Brand Awareness
* Business Understanding
* Proactive Thinking
* Attention to Detail
* Register/Point of Sales use
* Asset Protection
* Visual Displays
* System Skills

**Work Schedule Requirements**


Hours will vary weekly but should expect to work between 15 and 25 hours. Typically shifts will be spread across 3 to 5 working days weekly. Required to work most Saturdays and some Sundays. During the weeks of peak holiday seasons, Key Holder (Part Time) must have open availability that supports the needs of the business.

 **Qualifications** **What it Takes**

* At Least One Year of Customer Service Experience Preferred
* Customer Focus
* Communication
* Interpersonal Interaction
* Fashion Trend Knowledge
* Outgoing
* Assertiveness
* Adaptability/Flexibility & Stress Tolerance
* Poise & Ambition
* Multi-Tasking
* Applied Learning
* Promoting Diversity & Inclusion
* Work Ethic
* Omni Channel Services

 **Job Description** **The Program**


The Manager in Training program is a blended-learning, 90 day program focused on immersing a manager in all aspects involved in running a multi-million dollar business. Training takes place in store locations. The program trains you on the necessary principles of management including creating the best in-store experience, recruiting, inclusion & diversity, human resources, store operations and visual merchandising.

**The Career Progression**


The MIT must complete the training to be moved on into the Assistant Manager role. Successful completion of the program is the first step for leadership. The company strongly advocates philosophy of growth from within. All of our District Managers, Regional Managers, Directors, even our Vice President of Stores have gone through the MIT Program.

 **Qualifications** **What it Takes**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university
* Strong problem solving skills
* Inclusion & Diversity awareness
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment
* Team building skills
* Self-starter
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Drive to achieve results

  

**Additional Information** **What You’ll Get**

A&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! * Quarterly Incentive Bonus Program
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Volunteer Day per Year, allowing you to give back to your community

title: Hollister Co. - Assistant Manager, Roosevelt Field
description:
**Company Description**  

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (NYSE: ANF) is a leading, global specialty retailer of apparel and accessories for men, women and kids through five renowned brands. The iconic Abercrombie & Fitch brand was born in 1892 and aims to make every day feel as exceptional as the start of a long weekend. abercrombie kids sees the world through kids’ eyes, where play is life and every day is an opportunity to be anything and better anything. The Hollister brand believes in liberating the spirit of an endless summer inside everyone and making teens feel celebrated and comfortable in their own skin. Gilly Hicks, offering intimates, loungewear and sleepwear, is designed to invite everyone to embrace who they are underneath it all. Social Tourist, the creative vision of Hollister and social media personalities, Dixie and Charli D’Amelio, offers trend forward apparel that allows teens to experiment with their style, while exploring the duality of who they are both on social media and in real life.


The brands share a commitment to offering products of enduring quality and exceptional comfort that allow consumers around the world to express their own individuality and style. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. operates approximately 730 stores under these brands across North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East, as well as the e-commerce sites www.abercrombie.com, www.abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com, www.gillyhicks.com, and www.socialtourist.com.

 **Job Description** **The Program**


The Manager in Training program is a blended-learning, 90 day program focused on immersing a manager in all aspects involved in running a multi-million dollar business. Training takes place in store locations. The program trains you on the necessary principles of management including creating the best in-store experience, recruiting, inclusion & diversity, human resources, store operations and visual merchandising.

**The Career Progression**


The MIT must complete the training to be moved on into the Assistant Manager role. Successful completion of the program is the first step for leadership. The company strongly advocates philosophy of growth from within. All of our District Managers, Regional Managers, Directors, even our Vice President of Stores have gone through the MIT Program.

 **Qualifications** **What it Takes**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university
* Strong problem solving skills
* Inclusion & Diversity awareness
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment
* Team building skills
* Self-starter
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Drive to achieve results

* Quarterly Incentive Bonus Program
* Paid Time Off

* Merchandise Discount
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available
* Life and Disability Insurance

* Paid Parental and Adoption Leave
* 401(K) Savings Plan with Company Match
* Training and Development
* Opportunities for Career Advancement, we believe in promoting from within
* A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU

Gilly Hicks, offering intimates, loungewear and sleepwear, is designed to invite everyone to embrace who they are underneath it all. Social Tourist, the creative vision of Hollister and social media personalities, Dixie and Charli D’Amelio, offers trend forward apparel that allows teens to experiment with their style, while exploring the duality of who they are both on social media and in real life.


The brands share a commitment to offering products of enduring quality and exceptional comfort that allow consumers around the world to express their own individuality and style. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. operates approximately 730 stores under these brands across North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East, as well as the e-commerce sites www.abercrombie.com, www.abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com, www.gillyhicks.com, and www.socialtourist.com.

 **Job Description**  

The Assistant Manager is a multi-faceted role that merges business strategy, operations, creativity, and people management. Strategically, assistant managers are responsible for driving sales results by analyzing the business and providing best-in-class customer service. They are responsible for overseeing daily store operations including opening and closing routines and driving efficiency in all store processes. Assistant managers leverage their creative expertise through floorset updates, styling recommendations and product knowledge. Assistant managers are also talent leaders, driving everything from recruiting and training to engagement and development. They are expected to show up, bringing their best selves everyday to create an inclusive place of belonging for their team and customers. With a promote from within philosophy, our Assistant managers will build upon their initial foundation and have the opportunity to grow into the future leaders of our store’s organization.

  

**What You’ll Do**

* Customer Experience
* Drives Sales
* OMNI Channel Fulfillment
* Store Presentation and Sales Floor Supervision
* Store & Stockroom Operations
* Staffing, Scheduling, and Payroll Management
* Training and Development
* Communication
* Asset Protection

  

**Qualifications** **What it Takes**

* Bachelor’s degree OR one year of supervisory experience in a customer-facing role
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Inclusion & Diversity Awareness
* Ability to show up in a fast-paced and challenging environment
* Team building skills
* Self-starter
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Drive to achieve results
* Adaptability / Flexibility
* Multi-Tasking
* Fashion Interest & Knowledge

  

**Additional Information** **What You’ll Get**

A&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! * Quarterly Incentive Bonus Program
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Volunteer Day per Year, allowing you to give back to your community
* Merchandise Discount
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available
* Life and Disability Insurance
* Associate Assistance Program
* Paid Parental and Adoption Leave
* 401(K) Savings Plan with Company Match
* Training and Development
* Opportunities for Career Advancement, we believe in promoting from within
* A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU
